In a way I feel that this plays into how the franchise is now back in full form since X3 and Origins brought the quality down through the floor and with First Class turning it back in the right direction. It's easy to get pessimistic about the future when things don't go your way, but it goes to show in this film that things can and will get better in time. Hope sometimes really pays off, and the film's ending is the prime example. As far as the flaws, they don't really matter to me but I would've like one explanation as to why Mistyque wasn't in the future and how Kitty Pride had the time travel powers. But at the end of the day, they don't really matter. This movie has officially made my top comic book films of all time with TDK trilogy, Spider- Man 2 (2004), Winter Soldier and Avengers and I'll go as far as to call this movie my favorite of 2014. Thank you Bryan Singer, Simon Kinberg and the rest of the team for making this movie, and I look forward to seeing Apocalypse!

A cinematic experience of a gigantic magnitude (Yes, I realise I probably just put lots of words together with no regard for the rather insane interpretation... So what?)Highly anticipated and it did not fail in delivering..! As I said Mind Blown... Honestly, could it be anything but?By far the longest Xmen ever..!! Like really long... But wow! Content galore..! So anything can happen now..!! Is this the beginning of a complete reload? Can that happen? Would be cool? All the favourites? Coming together? Life as we know it completely altered...?Exactly where can we expect to be taken in the next Xmen..? (Because for sure there will be more..!!) hello..!! Is anyone excited? Get excited!!So sorry if you didn't get a chance to see it in the cinema, I watched it twice! Get your DVDs, in fact... Have a movie marathon! (Do it right) 10/10 for me! 😊

This movie shows how the times are changing. Here we can see that the superheroes cooperate with super-villains. The villain says: "All those years - wasted - fighting each other." Since the year 2000 we see a significant increase in cooperation in our society. Examples: cooperative games, cooperative enterprises, humanitarian associations, books, etc. For example, the book "Uniorder: Build Yourself Paradise" shows how to build the Utopia written by Thomas More 500 years ago. Now we can guess that 100 years from now there will be no bad guys - we will all be on the same side. Homo sapiens will become extinct. We will have Homo Cooperative.

**Spoiler included** Just to keep brief I thought it shed some light into Charles and Eric's past that was needed in the series. Overall great graphics, over plot played out and great directing and acting.This really takes the series to where it needs to go for Xmen Apocalypse. I give it a seven because they could have explained some parts of the film better.

I was looking forward to this movie coming out especially scents Bryan Singer was directing it. I was expecting an action comedy that was better than all the other moves. high standards I know but it delivered there were greatly choreographed fights (especially by quick sliver. the movie has 2 plots rolled into one wolverine trying to change the past and the X-men trying to survive it. the acting is no problem as usual. and thank god that they make Brett Ratner never happen but once again it proves that no one in this fancies stays dead but it is a vary good finale to the original cast and I can't wait to see what the next movie has in store

X-men DAYS OF Future past is An amazing movie. SPOILER HERENOT only the movie made x-men the last stand on don, which means that cyclops and Jean never died,but It's also the best movie in the franchise.The Special effects are incredible and you feel like you are in the future. The story is pretty good It's a good kinda sequel to first class.I think that the future could have a bit more screening time, maybe For the Blu-ray?The acting is really really good. And An amazing cast. The Young and old characters made the movie work For me (And because of Peter Dinklage).

reviews.review_title: Very Solid Entry in The X-Men Universe
reviews.content: We're 7 films in now into this world. And with 2 more on the way, it goes without saying that they're staying afloat by sheer demand from fans. There are a lot of people out there that are die hard 'X-men' fans, just like any other comic book series has. Some of the films are notably better than others. And while there are plot holes galore here (Yes they are plot holes I don't care what you tell me), and I don't think it's better than the latest 'Captain America' or 'X-Men II: X-Men United' for that matter; This movie is full blown turned up to 100 from the get go, with well executed action scenes, a lot of humor in the right places, and a HUGELY talented cast all giving good performances.The start of the film shows Earth as a desolate wasteland, thanks to the savage hunting machines known as the Sentinels. Originally created to hunt down and destroy only Mutants, the machines had since evolved in the future and began hunting anyone. So we see all of our favorite mutated heroes return and try to figure a way that can go back in time and prevent one of their own Mystique (Jennifer Lawrence) from executing the inventor of the Sentinels Dr. Bolivar Trask (Peter Dinklage). By preventing this event, it will reverse history so that humans will never decide to use the Sentinels to destroy mutants. And with one of many plot conveniences Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) is the only X-Men that can go back in time to reunite young Xavier (James McAvoy) and young Eric aka. Magneto (Michael Fassbender) in order to create a new better future for everyone.The volume of superhero films we get these days has made them become underwhelming to me for the most part. Rest assured though that this is one of the most solid entries in recent memory. Surprisingly the thing I enjoyed the most is the clever humor written into the script. There are hat tips to the previous films quite frequently yet I feel that this film is trying very hard to separate itself from them. The story builds to what an obvious leap into a brand new storyline. With 2 more films already in production this is no surprise.Along with the humor, there are a few sequences of action that are extremely impressive. Especially a sequence with the character Quicksilver (Evan Peters) that I will claim is one of the most impressive sequences of ANY action film in the last 15 years. It really is that good. The most simple and honest way I could describe the film is, fun. Even if you're not a die hard fan, there's a lot you can enjoy in the film. A movie with a cast this stacked and a director who is familiar with the loire and characters, would be hard pressed to make a movie that wouldn't be an enjoyable time.A problem I have with the film is it's lack of sensitivity to a younger audience. I mean, this isn't something I would usually talk about in relevance to a comic book film, however there's noticeable points in the film I thought to myself "Woah now, ease up a bit". A totally unnecessary F-bomb to start, which yes is a critique for a superhero movie. You'll have a great amount of young children attending this movie, they don't need to see superheroes dropping F-bombs. Also there's a weird script element in which the Charles Xavier and Hank aka Beast characters inject a serum of some sorts into themselves to keep their mutant powers at bay and to live more normally. What bothers me about it is that it subconsciously hints towards using heroin, as you literally see the characters tying bands around their arm in a panic and injecting themselves into their veins as if they're thriving for the serum. A tad inappropriate in my eyes, as there were numerous children under the age of 10 in the screening I was in and I couldn't help but feel uncomfortable watching those moments.Nitpicks aside there is no denying the film is greatly enjoyable. Wonderful actors giving it their all, and there's plenty of exciting moments equally balanced with emotional engagement and laughter. I can't rave on and on about how incredible it is because for one I'm not an avid die hard fan, and two it's not all that incredible. Just very well done; nothing we haven't seen before. Some have said it's one of the greatest super hero movies of all time which is in my mind a bit of a stretch. In comparison to some of the other films in this universe that have been dismal to say the least, it is definitely a breath of fresh air. It's not greatly profound however; Rather a nice flavor of the moment.

So this may just be the most pivotal movie in the X-Men franchise right now, and not just because it connects the trilogy to the Wolverine movies and to First Class. However, before I get started on that, allow me to recap the movies (and their problems).In the original trilogy set we saw Storm, Cyclopse and Jean as Charles' first students and see a new set of X-Men being readied. We watch as Logan develops from loaner/bad boy to part of the team - and still a bad boy. We get to see a war nearly erupt and be quelled all in one great moment. At the end of the trilogy we see Professor X dead, Jean and Scott dead, Raven and Magneto have lost their powers (although Magneto may have been regaining his if you go by the final scene in X3), and all seems to be well with the world again - more or less.First Class showed the beginning, but had some things wrong. We saw Scott's (Cyclopse) brother, even though Scott was supposed to be older and a first student. We see Azazle, a teleporter, which is only worth mentioning because the Professor was confused when they were tracking Nightcrawler as though he's never seen one before. Cerebro(sp?) apparently wasn't so much built by Charles and Erik as Hank(Beast) was the original creator. Charles couldn't walk by the end, even though in X3 we see him and Erik both WALKING into a young Jean's house after the events at Cuba. And several other things that didn't match and we could be here all day making that list, so I'll move on.The Wolverine took place after all of the above so I'll leave it alone, but Origins: Wolverine was pre-trilogy. My biggest complaint here is that this movie took it upon itself to proclaim Victor Creed as the official half-brother to Logan. We don't have any solid proof of this throughout canon, but it has been hinted to time and again. While this has zero holdings on the current matter at hand, I felt the need to mention it (as well as the less-than-appealing version of Gambit in this writer's opinion).Now, on to Days of Future Past, the real reason any of you are here. The majority of these issues are resolved in the movie, which seems to have been the whole point. We see the use of String Theory to reboot the franchise again (basically what Star Trek did), which I have no problem with at all. I'm actually very excited to see what the Disney-owned Marvel Studios will do with X-Men now that they have a clean slate. The way I see this going is basically the next set of movies will be a flash back filling in the history we don't know anymore. Or at least I hope that's how this roles forward, but we'll have to wait and see on that.All of the characters were portrayed expertly! We see Magneto returned to full strength (okay after the end of X3) working along side Professor X (never explained how he made his return from the grave). We have the kids all grown up with some new friends fighting the new enemy, and I love how they show future and past at the same time going through similar struggles from time to time. I am glad to say they didn't try to bring back Scott and Jean for the movie, one reincarnation is probably enough.At one point Hank even mentions Quantom Mechanics and how sometimes things are fixed and can't change in the time line, this will certainly allow for why some things never change. We will need some constants in our lives if we're to accept whatever comes after Day of Future Past.As for the movie itself, there was nothing poorly done here. The visuals were stunning! I didn't see it 3D, myself, but I have a friend that did and I'm told it's worth the extra couple of bucks. I know it may seem meaningless to some, but the soundtrack was wonderful. The brief interaction with Quicksilver was simply hilarious while maintaining a heroic nature; he may be a punk kid, but he certainly has potential. I'm actually sad that he won't be played by the same actor in the next Avengers movie. I couldn't help by try to see Tyrion Lanister in Trask's place, Peter Dinklage was great. The role wasn't entirely dissimilar, to be honest. A brilliant man attempting to change the world around him using whatever means at his disposal, Tyrion and Trask are brothers separated by years (and franchises).Overall if you're sad that Professor X died, unhappy with the inconsistency of the six movies to date, just want to see some bad-assery in the future and the past, then this movie is all about you!

I didn't had any expectation from the movie because I didn't knew what to expect from such a huge cast of talented actors in a superhero franchise. Any movie running simultaneously in two ages is difficult for both the audience and the director, but Wolverine guides us through it quite well. Although it had most of the mutants, but Wolverine, Prof X, Magneto, Beast and Raven has the most screen time. Rest are seen fighting the sentinels in the Future(or present if u say so). Talking about the sentinels(Future version) they were really the deadly mutant killing machine after the sentinels of the Matrix series, which were much more menacing. I may say that after the successful reboot of the X men series in X men First Class, X-Men: Days of Future Past continues the legacy. I had a good time watching it as I am crazy about these kind of stuff and enjoyed the Sunday morning.

reviews.review_title: Plot Holes Galore but very good.
reviews.content: Days of Future Past is a good film but you do have to ignore X-Men, X2, The Last Stand and The Wolverine in order to really enjoy it. I remember reading an interview with Bryan Singer stating that he wanted the time travel story line in order to clean up the continuity errors between all the films. This got me excited but he failed and DOFP just creates more questions than answers. The errors all stem from Kitty possessing the ability that allows the time travel, Professor X being alive and Logan having metal claws despite losing them in The Wolverine.So ignoring the above you will be in for an enjoyable film. The action is well thought out, especially watching the original cast and storm in particular. I always felt she was under used but she finally gets a stage to show her power. The sentinels are great adversaries, I never knew how they would fit in but it actually makes sense and I think Fassbender's and Lawrence's performances are outstanding. The best part is probably the story line and ending. It gives the old cast a good send off and the new ones a platform on where to take the story as they can effectively introduce younger counter parts of storm and co to show how Xavier formed the X Men or go in a brand new directions such as Gambit who is already confirmed in the next film.All in all I can't see many being disappointed. Just forget about the errors and watch it as a typical action film and you will feel like it was money well spent.Oh and stay to the end of the credits for an extra scene. Again it brings more questions than answers but that seems to be normal in this movie.

reviews.review_title: Finally a real comic based film
reviews.content: I wrote this immediately after watching the movie. the movie was so intriguing to me. This is not an action movie, it is a movie with good plot. Despite it was not action packed in the whole film, it was not boring. And the action scene were not created to impress the audience with explosion and muscle but to fulfill the task in storytelling. I could say every action scene was required to unfold the plot. (not a good sign for those who liked to see Hugh Jackman huge chest fans) The plot unfolded chronologically for most of the time and the audience should have no problem in understanding the film. clean and obvious one plot storytelling was a great tension builder. You could sense something big would happen as the plot unfold and at the same time those glimpse from the future would make your fist clenched.It is a very good film indeed

reviews.review_title: One question.. How can Professor Xavier is alive?
reviews.content: Hi all,I have one question, How can Professor Xavier is alive after he was died in 3rd installment (X-Men Last Stand) by Jean. May be I have missed something or may be this is plot hole?However, I loved X-Men movies but when I was watching this series second time then this question raised in my mind. Can anybody please clear this confusion ?? I think I surely missing something here as this can't be plot hole. If it is then it would be biggest mistake in movies for me.My favorite character of course is Wolverine. I would love to watch logan in Cinema. He is just awesome.

reviews.review_title: Best X-Men movie to have come out till date and also raises the standard of the X-Men Franchise
reviews.content: Director Bryan Singer returns back to the X-Men Franchise after a gap of 9 years and is blazing guns to make sure that his recent outing X-Men: Days of Future Past (2014) comes out well as this movie happens to be 7th movie in the series and third for Bryan Singer as director. Matthew Vaughn who had directed X-Men: First Class (2011) joins along with Singer as one of the writers for this movie.The movie begins in the dystopian future in the year 2023 where we are shown the last remaining X-Men fighting hard against the robots known as Sentinels, built for the solitary purpose of mutant obliteration. At one point, the X-Men who are alive regroup and devise a plan to stop the Mutant Annihilation before it ever begins and finally Professor X/Charles Xavier (Patrick Stewart) and Magneto/Erik Lensherr (Sir Ian Mc Kellen) decide to send Wolverine/Logan (Hugh Jackman) back in to the past to change the itinerary of events so that Mutants are left for good rather than dead. From this point, the movie travels back into the 1970s where the rest of the story builds and happens. Furthermore telling of the story would be like giving out the spoilers or even like revealing the complete plot.This movie's main strength lies neither in the Mind Blowing Visual Effects nor in the Cutting Edge Action Sequences as how most of the superhero movies rely upon; instead Bryan Singer has done a brilliant work in executing this movie with more attention provided in the areas of character design and depiction, storytelling and screenplay. The director deserves a mention and applause for the above since this movie has an ensemble cast of many X-Men characters sharing screen space in various situations and the makers have to be careful that not even a single moment in the movie gets overcrowded and goes haywire.The movie's casting is overwhelming since you have Hugh Jackman, Halle Berry, Michael Fassbender, Charles McAvoy, Ellen Page, Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Jeniffer Lawrence and Nicholas Hault sharing screen space throughout the movie , but they make their appearance suitably for the scenes where they are needed the most. One of the movie's most entertaining factors is the Short Cameo done by Quicksilver/Peter Maximoff (Evan Peters) which is sure to leave the viewers enthralled till the movie's end and also to mention the thrilling climax sequence where Magneto/Erik Lensherr (Michael Fassbender) yet again proves that why he is considered and feared as one of the most powerful mutants.This movie acts as a sequel to X-Men: First Class (2011) and X-Men: The Last Stand (2006) and also all other X-Men movies are linked with this movie so one has to have watched all movies in the X-Men franchise or at least have an idea of their main plot and happenings to get this movie completely at the end and how things have worked out. This movie keeps you thinking and puzzled at certain phases of the movie and you even think to have a re-watch of all X-Men movies again to make sure that you are following the movie in its way though you might have watched them all several times.To conclude, this is the Best X-Men movie to have come out till date and also raises the standard of the X-Men Franchise and also for the upcoming movie in the series. This movie will stand out and receive acclaims for it making, presentation and most of all for brilliantly using the concept of time travel mechanism.

reviews.review_title: X-Men: Days of Future Past is the key for the super-hero-movie evolution.
reviews.content: Back in 2000, X-Men was relished, and it proved that super-hero films can be realistic and serious. In 2003, X2 proved that sequels can be even better. X-Men: The Last Stand proved that super-heroes films can be huge disappointments. Then X-Men Origins: Wolverine was even worse. The Wolverine a bigger improvement than Origins, but again it wasn't full filing. But in 2011, X-Men: First Class brought back hopes for the franchise. This saga had uppers and downers for the last 13 years, which Bryan Singer brought the genre into a new level, by making the first two films, that after him many others followed. Now, he's back by bringing an all-star cast into X-Men: Days of Future Past. So, is it a letdown or a success? It's definitely, the best X-Men film till now. Singer is the father of this franchise and he makes one of Marvel's best projects. One of the biggest concerns of the film since the begging of the production was the oversize of the cast. There is this great balance of use for every character in the story, which you don't even care that most of them don't have much dialog. But the main heroes of the story are Wolverine, Professor X, Magneto and Mystic. Hugh Jackman once more plays the tough Wolverine, in probably in his best show run and he constantly reminds you why you love him in this role. Also, one of my favorite elements in First Class, which is the relationship between McAvoy's Xavier and Fassbender's Magneto, is here and in a more hostile environment. Jennifer Lawrence's Mystic was one of the main parts in the film, and the way her character was made for the development of the film was one of the smartest elements. But the film is based on the theme of Hope, which is connecting with Charles Xavier, who from James McAvoy's broken Xavier evolves to the mentor and leader Patrick Stewart's Professor X. McAvoy gives an astonishing performance which provides you most of the most dramatic moments of the film. Meanwhile, the biggest surprise is Quicksilver. He is the most entertaining part of the project and his scene in the Kitchen gets in main highlights and shows us the most interesting and awesome use of super speed. Without giving spoilers, this film is the redemption for every mistake that the previous installment had made. In verdict, Days of Future Past is an emotional action journey to the best X-Men film ever made, which gives the opportunity to an ever bigger Future for this amazing franchise. With this and Captain America The Winter Soldier, 2014 has become my favorite year for super heroes and being an even bigger fan for Marvel; next stop Guardians of the Galaxy, but it would be very difficult to surpass those two.

where to start.... i'll begin with this; the X-Men Series has been a mixed boat when it comes to movies, they have had their highs( like the first two X-men's and Arguably First Class) and their lows (Last stand, and Origins). So i was Sceptical when i had heard that they were making a new X-Men Movie i was torn on how i could feel about it, i loved First class but after hearing that it was going to include not just the first class cast, but the original cast as well, it heightened my Scepticism even further given that it was two huge cast's put together, but as the months pressed on, the anticipation grew and faith was slowly building for this movie.And shall i say, it didn't disappoint.Character wise, there is a lot of people to talk about. so ill keep it simple, each has their own part of this magnificent machine, and they all did their parts brilliantly, From the opening scene till the end, it was just amazing to see how well a movie can handle such a large cast, and not make it feel like it was just a bunch of extra's.What surprised me the most about this movie was that it in a lot of way's fixed what had hurt the other's, the Script was pure Genius with intertwining the old and new cast, the old and new movies, and just delivering everything it needed to right. the balance of story, and action was done beautifully. they way the powers were interpreted was just phenomenal.there was a few questions that rose during the movie ****(SPOILER)*****, what happened to Eric (magneto) when the future was changed? most likely we will find out in X- Men:Apocalypse.and also, now that we have this movie in place, Which cast will be in the next movie?Only time will tell. all in all though this movie had delivered where it needed to and just was a great movie.I understand that a lot of people will give this movie flack for not Following the Comic like it should (example being that Kitty Pryde is supposed to go back not wolverine) but to be honest the changes were made where they needed it to be. beside's they aren't making these comic book movies for just the comic readers, it's to make it appeal to everyone.i was absolutely blown away by the amazing writing and acting in this movie, i would go see it again and again and again. it had raised the bar for sure when it comes to comic book movies, it is definitely in my top three Comic book movies. if you have been considering going to see this movie. you will not be disappointed.and the after credit scene.... ill just say this... absolutely phenomenal.

To be honest, when the first X-Men movie came out the only reason I wanted to watch it was for Bryan Singers direction and Hugh Jackman's portrayal of Wolverine. And I was right they didn't disappoint.But then First Class came to light and it introduced us to brilliant actors like Michael Fassbender and James McAvoy. Finally there was a movie that revealed the reasons behind the complex relationship between them.Talking about the movie, it starts with a peek into the post-apocalyptic world that is torn apart form the fight against the Sentinals. Bryan's depiction of a futuristic world is both dark and horrific. Over the run time of 2 hours, Bryan manages to grab your attention from the first scene itself. With jaw dropping action sequences and a complex story line, I dare you take your eyes of it.Unlike its predecessor, this one is dark, gritty and brutal. It also dwells into the complexities of quantum physics and time travel which will make your head spin.Bryan brings back the old characters giving you a sense of nostalgia. He also introduces you to some new ones, but the fact that they are given very little screen presence leaves you a bit disappointed.Hugh and Fasbender are back portraying their respective roles with even more conviction and dedication. McAvoy's performance of a man who has lost his path, only to be asked to find a way that will lead to the salvation of mankind, is heart clenching.A quick mention to Evan Peters, who plays the role of quicksilver to perfection. I am, though, a bit disappointed by the performance of Jennifer Lawerence. Being the integral part of the story, she lacked the conviction required to play the role.To conclude, I had a hell of a joy ride. With a cast to die for and action scenes leaving everybody breathless, you will definitely leave the theater wanting to grab the tickets for the next show. So go grab your movie buddies and enjoy this summer blockbuster.

Wow, look at that. It's the highest rating I've given a movie on this site so far! Honestly, it deserves that 8 out of 10. The plot was tightly written, the stakes were established early on (if you fail, there will be no more anything) and the future Sentinels with Mystique powers carry an appropriate amount of menace. I miss the old designs when they were huge like buildings, but practically speaking it makes a lot more sense for them to be small enough to go indoors. Master Mold is tragically absent from the movie, though. I think that could have been a good twist, especially since the opening sequence with Patrick Stewart narrating over it invoked some Terminator flashbacks. The actor who plays Dr. Trask (since when was he a doctor of anything?) has very little to work with. Oh, god, that sounds like a joke. It's not, though! He doesn't have a lot of menace or motivation. Why does he want to kill all mutants? Simple Darwinism? Or is it greed because he wants to sell the Sentinels to the highest bidder? General Stryker in X2 had a clearly defined reason for what he was doing. And will somebody do something about that stupid hair?! Oh my god. I know that's just what the style was in the 70s but between that haircut and that porn 'stache I was expecting him to go full on Anchorman at any minute.Moving on. So, apparently they had fully operational Sentinels in the 70s. Where were they when Magneto was ripping the Golden Gate Bridge out of its foundation and pointing it at Alcatraz?! Or when Magneto tried to mutate every possible world leader in New York City? Why wouldn't they immediately execute him when he was captured in the first movie if it's a matter of public record that he killed John F. Kennedy?And Mystique, supposedly the one responsible for the entire future going to Hell, is apparently some kind of anti-hero now? An anti-hero that refuses to wear pants, by the way. At some point between this movie and First Class, she took over the team that Magneto was leading and got them all killed. Did she already give birth to Nightcrawler? Speaking of, she seems pretty spry in the first X-Men movies for someone without a healing ability that's roughly the same age as Xavier. Also, does her power also include super durable skin? Because she kicks Magneto right in the helmet and it doesn't bother her. What about walking on a hot sidewalk? Why does she replace Stryker and capture Wolverine? Is it in her contract that every movie has to end with her being somebody else and flashing her eyes at the audience? Why does she wait to be detected by Trask in the panic room before making her move? How was Magneto able to survive being shot through the jugular? Did Quicksilver ever find out Magneto was his father? Why was Toad in the movie and what was with those goggles? Why did they bring Quicksilver along only for him to leave the movie after a few minutes? Why don't they make a Flash movie with those effects?!Ahem. Sorry. Despite all of these questions, I still really enjoyed the movie. Remember 8 out of 10? I just can't stop the questions. And why does Apocalypse look so wimpy!? Okay, last one.

reviews.review_title: X Men is lovely and stories series
reviews.content: I love this movie. I really dug with 'First Class' who had a tough task rebooting the franchise after the lackluster 'Last Stand' and the generic, dull 'X-Men Origins: Wolverine' and I wouldn't have minded him returning at all.For its sheer scale and epic storytelling alone, 'Days of Future Past' is fantastic. I had seen the movie 5 times. It is action movie. It's a shame there's so much controversy surrounding this film, but I guess whoever chooses to deprive himself willingly of such a pleasure must be fully aware that he does so at his own expense. Because this is the kind of film that made me fall in love with movies in the first place.For finding that perfect, rare balance between character-driven human drama and no-holds-barred popcorn action spectacle, 'Days of Future Past' deserves my 10-star rating.Enjoy it as full

reviews.review_title: 84% - Great movie with an even greater ending!
reviews.content: This movie is unlike every other superhero movie! It shows Logan go back in time to save the mutants from sentinels that are killing them off in the present. This idea is something everyone thinks about, but no one ever tries to create in a movie. This is the first time I've ever seen this done, and it is done perfectly! The movie's ending makes it even better. Jean Gray is back from the dead, in Logan's eyes, and Cyclops is there to ruin the moment, just like old times. Great movie, especially of 2014, and right behind First Class in my opinion!

Quicksilver with a Pink Floyd T touring the Pentagon living an absolutely hyperbolic speed as if time stopped while listening to background Time in a bottle Jim Croce and walks down the walls changing place all objects (including weapons policemen) until the bullets are about to kill Professor X, Magneto, Beast and Wolverine to, and deviates with a wonderful delicacy; a cap of an officer standing and watch the scene you just created, while the police fall to the ground and the X-Men are saved and contemporary cinema receives a scene of absolute enjoyment of orgasmoeterno, a scene that is worth a thousand tickets to film, a scene that literally left me with my mouth open for more than five minutes without being able to react. I am more than done seeing this brilliant film. (google translate, sorry but IMDb doesn't accept Spanish)

Always look forward to Xmen films as am a huge Marvel fan. Deliberately don't watch trailers as I feel they ruin the film, so had no expectations before hand. Cannot give a proper review without spoilers so I will just say that James McAvoy is a brilliant actor and Jennifer Lawrence is awesome as Mystique. For any Marvel fan it will be a fantastic experience - and the ending is surprising. Am looking forward to more in the same vein - really think that James is the perfect actor to take over from Patrick Stewart. He has the presence on screen to carry it off. One thing I must say is that this is first film for a few years that hubby and I have seen in 3D and it was amazing. 3D has come on leaps and bounds and it was like being IN the film. Think we are converts!!

reviews.review_title: Excellent movie but with unnecessary lame super hero quips
reviews.content: The plot is 10 out of 10.The effects are 10 out of 10.The X-Men mutants are 10 out of 10.The dialog of future X-men is preachy, and full of typical super hero movie lame quotes. The movie is a bit lengthy as well. But all of that gets over shadowed because this movie is way better than any of its predecessors.I would recommend this to anyone from an entire family to a date to a long time fan of the X-Men franchise.. . .

I was so intrigued about this movie. I had a terrible feeling of disappointment because First Class was absolutely fine and riveting. That one was even better than X-Men 2 (the last one directed by Brian Singer before this). So I tried to went to see this with low expectation. And what a wonderful entertainment and surprising thoughtful story I found here. Days Of Future Past is the best X-men movie so far for two main reasons:Fans of the original trilogy and First Class will definitely enjoy this one thanking its nostalgia and its perfect and well balanced mix between the original characters and the new ones (with just a few ones who maybe deserved more credit, but is not at all a problem for the movie). & This movie delivers a surprising top notch entertaining with a potent story and some good twists that help to live up expectations mixed with terrific special effects and cinematography. 3-D is very cool here.The actors are fantastic. Fassbender and McAvoy still delivering amazing performances meanwhile Stewart and Mckellen give their reflections in the same excellent way that in the trilogy. Hugh Jackman finally finds his character as a true important one in comparison with the last movies. Wolverine/Logan finally has a proper treatment in this movie that will help anyone who could be annoyed with his solo adventures to love him again. They are the five main stars of the story with the inclusion of a spectacular and skillful Mystique (impressive Jennifer Lawrence who steals almost every scene of hers) who is undoubtedly the sixth one. The other actors made good performances and make possible the transitions of the story until the amazing finale.It has been so many comparisons with The Avengers. Let me tell you something with all my respect. I found this one truly better. X-Men: Days of Future Past will please the fans and moviegoers and will inject fresh blood and joy to the franchise. This is a terrific time at the movies. Don't miss the opportunity to see it.

I guess this is the best movie in the X-men series. The story is superb the character's acting is more than awesome, the effects are outstanding. You will watch two stories running in two parallel universes: one in the year 1973 and the other is 50 years advance. "Hugh Jackman" or "Logan" is the only actor that exist in both stories and all the other characters are represented by two different actors. I can say both actors for the same character are outstanding "James McAvoy" and "Patrick Stewart", "Michael Fassbender" and "Ian McKellen" are the awesome faces of the past and the future. The most important and good thing about the movie is that some old characters in the X-men series were brought back to life again at the end of the movie which open new stories and adventures to the writers. I recommend it to all guys who love sci-fi movies it is really worth watching .

reviews.review_title: Greatest X-Men Film Of All Time
reviews.content: Wow. Simply a legendary film. Bryan singer proved that he is one of the best directors living.Hugh Jackman as good as always. Wolverine was great. McAvoy , Fassbender and Jennifer Lawrence were way beyond phenomenal.Quicksilver ( Evan Peters) was the coolest guy in the film. A couple of great funny scenes. A list of tense, action packed and suspenseful scenes.The score was good. The effects were amazing and the writing was superbly done.A must see. If I were you, I would watch it as quickly as possible.

reviews.review_title: Best Film for the year! A must see!
reviews.content: This film leaves more questions than it answers. But with these new questions, comes and whole new branch possibilities that could happen. With everyone back to where they should be... it gives the impression that there is going to be one hell of a film on it's way. And I'm not going to be the only one that is going to be checking the internet every day for any new information.If I'm going to compare it to all the other Marvel films i will have to say that it is most likely my favourite and that not only will i be buying the blue-ray I'm going to go back and re-watch it a few more times in the cinema. It really is a brilliant film. I cannot fault it in anyway.

reviews.review_title: Just what the X-Men universe needed!
reviews.content: At first I gave this film a 7/10 rating as I thought there wasn't enough action, but after I got home and thought back on the film I couldn't help but think that that rating didn't do the film justice. Yes, there wasn't as much action as I would have liked, but this film wasn't about the action. This film corrected a lot of the wrongs which were made in X-Men: The Last Stand and X-Men Origins: Wolverine, so the 'talking' scenes were needed.There were plenty of things I loved about this film: - Wolverine made this film for me! Hugh Jackman was brilliant once again, not just as the comedian of the film but also keeping you on the edge of your seat in other scenes. Just an overall great actor and perfect for his character.I loved the new characters that were introduced! Blink (Bingbing Fan) was my favourite and the way her teleportation power was portrayed in the film was amazing! Also, Bishop (Omar Sy) was another character who I enjoyed watching, and I definitely think we'll be seeing more of both of these either in their own origins films or in future X-Men films. The character I didn't think I would like was Quicksilver (Evan Peters); after seeing him in the trailer I assumed he was going to be cheesy and over the top cocky. However, I couldn't have been more wrong. Even though I thought the blue hair was a bit much, Peters did a brilliant job and his comment to Magneto about his 'mother dating a guy who could control metal' was a nice touch as well. Lastly, Toad's (Evan Jonigkeit) makeover in this film was a huge improvement from previous films in my opinion; just a pity we didn't see much of him.One thing I didn't like while watching the film was that there was no main mutant bad guy. Yet, as the film goes on you realise that this is where you see Magneto turning into that human hating villain we see in the first 3 X-Men films; which was brilliant!In my opinion, the ending was perfect. After Mystique (Jennifer Lawrence) stops Magneto and saves the future from the creation of the Sentinels, we see the dark future we've been watching all film disappear and we see Wolverine back at Xavier's school. Here, we see all the original cast back together (even Jean Grey (Famke Janssen) and Cyclopse/Scott Summers (James Marsden), and even Kelsey Grammar returns as Beast/Hank McCoy!) which really got me excited for what could happen in the future (an X-Men 4 and 5?!).There was only a few things which bothered me: - I thought this film was based a bit too much on Mystique, time which could have been used on other characters who didn't have much screen time; which leads me on my next point...Havoc/Alex Summer (Lucas Till) was one of my favourite characters in X-Men: First Class, and I just thought his cameo in this film was pointless. Really would have loved to have seen more of his character getting involved. Same with Toad and Quicksilver.Lastly, how is future Prof. X/Charles Xavier (Patrick Stuart) alive?! This still hasn't been explained and it really bothers me! I know we had that scene at the end of The Last Stand where we hear his voice in that other body which implies his consciousness is now in that body, but how is he back in his original body? I know I should probably just forget about that film but I just want an answer!All I can say is, thank you Bryan Singer; because this film was needed to bring balance back to this universe. Now I've seen this I can finally say I'm excited for the X-Men franchise to continue!

since there is no doubt that this movie is excellent in comparison to others or previous xmen movies......this movie is full pack action movie. If you are crazy about xmen series than must watch but if you had not seen previous movies. than its difficult or maybe impossible to understand the movie. As it is clear from the name ( xmen days of future past) and from trailers that it is connected from past and future you will see both younger ones and older ones of the same mutant that will be more exciting and there will so much twists in the movie that will definitely blow your mind and yes hats off to brian singer. some new excellent mutants will be seen whom you will definitely like and yes no one can forget wolverine( hugh jackman) again with more power great action. purhaps because of time limit of the movie and there is so much actors inspite of that brian has manage there rolls very decently and you will definitely not blink your eyes while watching movie......10 on 10 no doubt :-)

reviews.review_title: Restores the X-Men series to what it was
reviews.content: Having Bryan Singer back in charge clearly makes all the difference in the world. This man was born to make X-Men films. The first two X-Men movies were excellent, also done by Bryan Singer. X-Men: the last stand was an OK movie with some very bad logic flaws but the two wolverine films prior this were terrible in my opinion. The first thing this movie does right is it appears to disregard these completely. Because of X- Men: the last stand, Bryan Singer had his work cut out for him to undo all the logic flaws and I must say I was a bit skeptical after the epic fail of superman returns, but you can clearly see that Singer has done his homework and created a magical film with a lot of heart in the story and characters. Without giving too much away, I will say that every scene is breathtaking. The story is a well-constructed piece of emotion and heart. What really makes this film work is the complexity of the characters, especially Charles Xavier (professor X, both older and younger), Raven, and Magneto. What all these characters have in common is they are all tortured souls. As for Logan, well, Hugh Jackman is always fantastic, but the real star of the show is McAvoy, Fassbender, Lawrence. All of their characters help you to feel something for them. This movie presents a time travel paradox, if you cannot look past that or are a viewer that prefers mainly non fiction, or cannot take sci fi leaps of faith, ignore this review. We'll both be better off.See this film. It is probably the best superhero movie of the last decade. The only ones that are of the same caliber of superhero movies are Christopher Nolan's Batman movies. In some ways this film is even better. Rating: 10

This film is perfect best acting best slow motion scene ever the cast of both franchises fixing up the worst parts of the series and Bryan Singer shows us that if had directed the last stand it would've been so much better. All the actors were great except Jennifer Lawrence and I wish they showed more of the future. but aside from those two problems this movie was just perfect.

This is my first review for the site, and what a movie to start with. Now, as a kid I was a giant comic book nerd. Only thing was, I was only into Spiderman. Because of this I have very little experience with the X-Men comics. Because of this movie, that will soon change. My friend whom I saw this with, informed me that this was very close to the comics however. Now, this movie starts in a future (obviously) where things have gone wrong. Mutants, mutant sympathizers, and parents of future mutants, and being hunted down and killed preemptively in a cross between Minority Report and 1984. In order to stop this, the mutants decide to send Wolverine's consciousness back to 1973 in order to convince Professor X and Magneto to stop an assassination of a wealthy weapons manufacturer. This is a very deep story however, as it goes into the mind of Professor X as not only his school and best friend are ripped from him, but also the love of his life. It's almost painful to watch this wise old Obi-Wan figure turning to drug abuse just to stay sane. Wolverine does play a huge part in this movie, but don't worry. He may be the main character, but he doesn't overshadow anyone at all. In fact, the other characters almost overshadow him instead. In true X-Men movie fashion, there are deaths, and they are brutal. There were also quite a few scenes that made me flinch, and I'm saying that as someone who can gut a deer. I wouldn't recommend it for anyone under 13, but I can't speak for everyone out there. There is quite a bit of comic relief to balance out the painful parts though. One scene in particular which involves breaking into the Pentagon had everyone in the theater in tears they were laughing so hard. So it's not Dark Knight depressing I would recommend this for anyone who has enough willing suspension of disbelief that they can take comic book movies (because let's face it, they aren't even remotely possible). Anyone else would probably be better off watching something boring while we're having fun.

reviews.review_title: X-men : Days of future past (A diamond by Bryan Singer to marvel)
reviews.content: X- men days of future past is the best x-men & best marvel movie till date oh yes believe me, It's the best movie of 2014 till date, Bryan singer done justice with x-men movies, just saw it in 3d, it has greatest 3d effects and the story, the cast, the CGI and it never make you bored. I am a big fan of DC movies but after watching days of future past all I can say is that if you are fan of superhero movies then you should have watched this, it's never let you down.Director Bryan Singer make another masterpiece, the story is amazing and the cast done wonderful job. I have no idea how I can pass two hours when I watch this movie, it's the busy movie and make you stick with your seats. It's the 2nd best superhero movie I ever saw in my life (first was the dark knight 2008). If you are planning to saw it then go don't listen to bad reviews.Strengths1 The Cast itself and all of them done great acting 2 The story is amazing 3 Best effects, CGI 4 Gripping of the story never make you bored 5 It has one of the best action scenes 6 Direction, Screenplay just awesomeWeakness1 Its duration (only two hours) 2 less screening time for cast (I think it's usual in multicasting)Marks out of 10 Story - 10 <> Cast - 10 <> Action - 9 <> CGI - 9 <> Acting - 10 <> Screenplay - 10 <> Direction - 10 Movie – 10 I gave 10 out of 10 I found no major mistakes in this movie, just few plot holes but the movie is extremely entertaining, Just looking forward to X-Men: Apocalypse (2016)

WHAT.A.REDEMPTION for Fox! My initial thought: the first 10 minutes of a movie is supposed to be attention grabbing. Well, I thought too soon (first 2-3 minutes sucked). Adapting Sentinels ... whose brilliant idea was that? There really would have been no hope whatsoever for mutants. Why does the actress that plays Kity Pryde look so old? I hope everyone that sees this film takes note of Hugh Jackman's naked body! The man is FORTY FIVE years old! And that is what his body looks like. Raven Darkholme kept this movie exciting and action packed. Whoever thought to cast Michael Fassbender as Erik Lehnsherr should be paid a billion bucks! That man is amazing for his role! I was NOT impressed with Evan Peters being casted as Quicksilver, but to my surprise, he did an outstanding job. I just wish they didn't have his hair so stiff. The long hair on James McAvoy was extremely appealing. The whole time, I'm wondering how the hell is he walking and how does Beast look like his human self? DUH!! I clearly neglected to remember the far reaches of Hank McCoy's intelligence. The ending: what a NICE surprise!! Make sure you stick around for the after credits scene.

Generally i am not a regular reviewer but after watching this awesome movie i'm writing this review . the movie was a blast all characters was perfect , script was innovative dimension travel was the first thing that a marvel fan has never seen before . the only thing i hated about this movie is that the mystique has the lead role in this movie which is not so cool . Hugh Jackman was fantastic as usual . the movie start when the sentinels about to end the mutant species then wolverine decides to go in the past and make the wrong decisions right where he finds Charles Xavier (young) and stop mystique from killing tr ax corp. owner and my favorite scene from the movie is when silver surfer saves magneto from police when they are breaking out . overall X-mantis-tic movie .

In my humble opinion this one was a lot better than future past. I thought the characters were awesome and I'm glad they brought back some old faces as well. Not all the old faces but faces none the less. There is this one funny scene in the movie that you should have read about. Of course I'm not going to tell you myself you should go see the movie. The title speaks for itself when it says days of future past. It basically goes back in time and tell what lead to the action in the beginning of the movie which was awesome so many >>> not going to say.The main reason I like it because it combined the old cast with the new ones. What I mean by the old one from x-men 1 to 3. I found that 1-3 were the better ones they made sense. The plot was awesome and it focused around a character that should have not been focused but yeah, Go see it is just as good as captain America: the winter soldier. Not better but just as good!

reviews.review_title: The X-Men are back on form!
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past is an outstanding achievement, Director Bryan Singer and Writer Simon Kinberg deliver the X-Men movie you've been waiting for since X2. The old magic is back with the likes of Ian McKellen, Patrick Stewart and Hugh Jackman reprising their roles from the original trilogy alongside James McAvoy and Michael Fassbender from X-Men: First Class. The film is packed with incredible action scenes, brilliant acting and some hilarious Wolverine moments. Fans of Magneto will be blown away by both 1973 and future Magneto's action sequences that are even more spectacular than his previous shenanigans. A little dark in places but otherwise a great film for both X-Men fans and those who may be unfamiliar with previous films.

reviews.review_title: Top 5 Super Hero movie of all time
reviews.content: Movie was great every second of the way. Tied together the past and present seamlessly and brought back many conversations from movies way way in the past full circle. Characters show sides of them that you never have seen before which is great to watch. Actions scenes are awesome and none feel forced or overdone. This is a must see X-Men/ Super Hero movie. I pray this does well in the box office so that we can continue to see awesome X-Men films be created. The movie leaves you excited and interested in what their next plan is. With the whole idea of both past and present characters having their own movies we could be in for a whole ton of X-Men films coming our way. The only knock I have on this movie is that staying till the end of the credits for the final clip is not worth it at all. This is the worst one yet. That is my only complaint thought. I never write any reviews but was compelled to do so this time. This was a 10/10.

Anyone who doesn't want to know few details should stop reading this. My main problem in this movie (which is great) is that sentinels from the future are just too powerful. I mean they are able to hold multiple mutant powers at once, not even Apocalipse was not so mighty. They can heal, turn to flame or ice or diamond..., shoot energy beams, extremely strong... If you ask me, this is just too much for a machine. Also in the future there are not many humans too, because sentinels can detect ability to pass x gene to children. So, people in charge from time to time should be executed because they'll be on turn to pass x genes on to their children. In general I had great time in cinema, but my problem is that I'm trying always to follow logic in the story

reviews.review_title: Possibly the Best X-Men Film Yet
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past may be an overwhelming film for those who are unfamiliar with the rest of the franchise. Despite this, the film's opening narration explains the basics required to understand the plight of mutants. Though it does bother me that Kitty Pryde is not the one being sent into the past, Days of Future Past was surprisingly not another Wolverine and the X-Men. I like him a lot and everything, but he already has two solo films and the original trilogy is mostly Wolverine-centric anyway. Instead, Logan is used a way of letting us see the conflict between Charles Xavier, Magneto, and Mystique. The future mutants work together as a tired and war weary group of survivors. Despite the fact that they were all mostly underused, their scenes were definitely entertaining. This is the movie that reminds us that the X-Men are a team. The past mutants were great as well, but even though Mystique's agency is what defines the future, we see less of this and Mystique is mostly treated as an out of frame entity. I would not mind this choice if Mystique's choice was not the foundation of the plot, but in this movie it is so it doesn't really make sense for her to exist mostly through Charles' and Erik's bickering. Magneto also feels a bit extra at times in the movie. This is really Charles Xavier's film in terms of the past scenes, I suppose. The movie has a darker tone, and incorporates humor in an organic way; it doesn't feel contrived, even though at one point Quicksilver is running around while Jim Croce's 'Time in a Bottle' plays in the background. There is no back and forth snappy and clever argument, which is something I personally dislike in a film. The movie in total is well acted, and the cast is quite talented. The cinematography was better than the standard superhero fare, and I enjoyed that, especially in the future scenes. Overall, this is a great film, and especially great for the X-Men films, which still suffer from X-Men: The Last Stand. I would recommend this to any fans of Marvel, and even if that isn't to your taste, it's still a great movie.

reviews.review_title: A mechanic work to join stories
reviews.content: A future with holocaust and battle camp theme. Similar for other futures like Terminator Salvation. I don't really understand where they brought the argument for make this time machine. Compare to X Men: First Class, there are more action and less humor. Mr. Singer prefers more action than comedy. I agree with his point of view. But, he's able to break an story for keep the action scenes. In addition, Mr. Vaughn stopped this madness. The poetic moments owe him.Big changes in some characters. That makes interesting movie. It's curious to watch three academy awarded actors Mrs. Berry, Miss Lawrence and Miss Paquin powerless than Mr. Fassbender. I repeat what I have said in other reviews: Wait to the complete end of all credits. You will thank me.

So if Raven hadn't killed Trask an gotten caught, the horrible future with the sentinels wouldn't come to be. Well you need not bother with her to fix the past. Or wolverine and beast could come visit and permanently convince him to not pursue his agenda further. Or charles could stop wallowing in self pity and permanently convince Trask. He would surely earn some small amount of affection from raven should he do it
i do not like stupid scripts. kiss.

reviews.review_title: Splendid -Right from the first poster to the first trailer to the post credits scene !!
reviews.content: I was running out of patience to see this flick , I pre booked the movie tickets and the beauty was worth every PENNY !Right from the start to the end it develops that gripping and edge of the seat rhythm. The plot was brilliantly executed and direction was flawless. It was smart , fast and to the point ! Mr Brian Singer now can be officialy called the FATHER OF X-MEN movies. The character development was unquestionable . The movie leaves no questions or doubts unanswered . TWO THUMBS UP FOR JACKMAN , JAMES MCAVOY , MICHAEL FASBENDER (who was splendid) , JENNIFER LAWRANCE and the entire cast and crew.Post credits scene was too good . reviews.review_title: Saved the franchise and started a new one
reviews.content: In my opinion, this movie filled the hole that X-men: The Last Stand and X-men Origins: Wolverine made with the X-men franchise. X-men: First Class clawed the franchise out of its hole. Bringing Bryan Singer back was a smart move. Honestly, this movie exceeded my expectations! They did a good thing bringing back the old cast, and also bringing in new ones. There is a good blend of action, comedy, drama, and sci-fi. And the made a smart move with the end credits scene. Like most moviegoers, people (like me) would have to do some research and find out that it's a lead up to X-men: Apocalypse. Now I'm super excited again! I applaud you good, smart movie company! *CLAPCLAPCLAPCLAP* Bryan Singer did an excellent job casting, directing, and doing a quality job overall. And someone give a raise to whomever wrote this script! I'm serious! Excellent movie!!! (also I still gave a spoiler, but no major, major ones that's the best part of the movie!) http://screenrant.com/x-men-days-of-future-past-spoilers-end-post- credits-scene-apocalypse/2/ Here's if you want to learn more about the end credits scene!!

reviews.review_title: Didn't Professor kill in X-Men Last Stand?
reviews.content: Fiction of moive is good. But this movie is inconsistent with other ones. In X-Men Last Stand, Proffesor Xavier killed by Jean Grey. But he is alive in this movie. It is weird.

Here we have another X-Men movie with Wolverine in the centre. Oops, I misspelled Mystique! Do not get me wrong; I love Mystique. I adore her at an extreme level and always liked how essential of a role she had in the trilogy, yet I do not think that she is THIS important of a character.I also like Jennifer Lawrence and her performance as Katniss Everdeen a lot, but I have never agreed on how she is the right choice for this part. She is a pretty woman, but not drop-dead gorgeous. Mystique is a femme fatale; she is sexy as hell and deadly and frightening all at the same time. Romijn has that spirit, Lawrence does not.Another reason why Mystique becomes the protagonist of the film is the misuse of other characters. Wolverine is supposed to be the main character here, considering that Shadowcat's own story was changed to make Wolverine get the spotlight once again, but he is like Wasp amongst the Avengers: useless. He has no important role except for the "physically-strong-thingy" and is lame from the first second of the film till the last one.You thought less important X-Men like Kitty Pryde or Colossus had unsatisfactory screen time in the previous instalments? Watch this one. Kitty gets wounded in spite of her ability, Colossus can be seen being smashed by a Sentinel time to time, Bishop looks like he is in a Hallowe'en costume, Sunspot is a fusion of Human Torch and Sunfire, Warpath acts like a regular warrior except for his "Elf eyes" scene, and Blink and Blink only can be defined splendid.Let's not forget the best one of course: Quicksilver! Despite my prejudice, he was perhaps the best X-Men character ever to be on the white screen. "The scene" was just incontrovertibly spectacular. If Avengers: Age of Ultron nails it half as much, that will be a great movie.Now stop taking me seriously and go see how horrible Beast's make-up still is and how awful Mystique's has become. Do not miss Ms. Darkholme's Matrix fighting style and try taking a tequila shot every single time Stewart, McKellen or Berry has a scene. You will not leave the theatre drunk, believe me.PS: Wait for the scene at the end of the credits for the next X-Men villain. Do not bother to waste your time if your knowledge of superheroes end with the movies.

reviews.review_title: The new X-Men are just getting better
reviews.content: I'll keep it short: Epic. While the first X-Men trilogy was a decent effort, the re-imagined "First Class" garnered significant praise for its success fixing what was broken and not making the same mistakes. It was a world that pulled us in more and felt less like we were watching a movie. Days of Future Past is as much an improvement on First Class, as First Class was on the earlier trilogy. It takes what was done right in first class and continues it - first and foremost, it keeps its tradition of high quality actors playing to their individual strengths. It's got me excited for what we have to look forward to in the future.This is a movie worth seeing in the theaters. Bottom line, I think this goes down as one of the great comic book movies.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I've seen
reviews.content: I've been a little burnt out on superhero movies lately, especially X-Men movies. Well I finally decided to give this a shot last night and wow, I never expected it to be this good. This is not only one of the best superhero movies made it's simply one of the best movies I've seen. There are so many awesome moments in this movie but the stand out has to be Quicksilver. Much in the same way Night crawler stole the show in X2 Quicksilver does the same here. Beast is far better done this time around and it was cool to see Wolverine kick butt with his bone claws especially when I wasn't to keen on the idea to start. One again Michael Fassbender is amazing as Magneto. Great to see the old cast back as well. I can't wait to see the next movie now.

So this movie was okay I've seen many times and still enjoyed watching it but my only complaints are was that there wasn't so much scenes from the future I felt that the movie focus way too much in the past and as always not enough character development which has always been a problem for the movies the only characters that fully developed were Xavier and Mystique played by James McAvoy and Jennifer Lawrence respectively which they both did an amazing job and a step up I might say even though I assume J-Law winning that Oscar was given more time to play the shapeshifting Raven and James really gave all his effort for playing miserable Charles and took the lead as leading man unlike Michael Fassbender who stole the show in First Class. Rogue was cut off which left me disappointed but we'll be ready for the alternate cut of the movie on DVD soon. Quicksilver was a highlight. Bolivar Trask by Peter Dinklage was a missed for me because he wasn't much of a villain like his comic book counterpart not his fault but felt he was mishandled by the script he was given or was poorly miscast but the sentinels were the main villains of the movie although I believe ignorance itself was the main villain in the movie. It bothered me so much that Patrick Stewart and Ian mckellan, Halle berry great actors who all had little roles because of personal issues and or other commitments in other projects I would like to see more of Erik and his magnetic charm and powerful Storm herself have much larger screen time but nope. All the other characters were great but hardly some of them had lines mostly they just look cool and engaged in battle and that's all. But this movie was okay not a masterpiece nor a classic but a good chapter in the x men movie franchise.

reviews.review_title: This is how every superhero movie should be
reviews.content: Marvel is rocking in 2014. First Captain America: The Winter Soldier hit the box office records now it is time for X men: Days of Future Past. All the credits for its success goes to its wonderful director Bryan Singer. When I first heard how many characters he is going to involve in this movie, I did not think that he will be able to justify all the characters. But after watching the movie I can say he did marvelous work. None of the characters feels like heavy load to watch. Every superhero character was doing superhero work not like other movies where they are in the movie just for appearance. Experience was thrilling from beginning to the end. Special effects were so real. Nothing to say about acting department. Jennifer Lawrence ,Michael Fassbender,Peter Dinklage and all the actors(Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen had less screen time compared to previously mentioned actors) have played their part perfectly but Jemes McAvoy and Hugh Jacman are amazing. Movie is best X men movie till date. This movie is good entertainment for hardcore comics fan as well as casual movie goer.

I have always enjoyed the X-Men. From TV shows to Movies, they have always interested me. However, X-Men: days of Future Past is the best one yet. Story- 9/10The Days of Future Past storyline could have been difficult arc to adapt into a movie, becoming confusing for casual moviegoers and non-comic readers. However, the story was handled with such delicacy that it was a marvel to watch. Acting- 9/10Like any superhero team-up movies, there is always going to be a big group of actors. All of the major characters were portrayed very well, with Wolverine (Hugh Jackman), both Magnetos (Michael Fassbender & Ian McKellen), both Professor Xs (James McAvoy & Patrick Stewart) and Mystique (Jennifer Lawrence) being extraordinary as always. However the "acting" from Halle Berry as Storm wasn't up to scratch with the rest of the film. Direction- 9/10Bryan Singer's X-Men comeback was pretty good for the director of the first two impressive films. The hidden Xs throughout the film, the cutting between past and future and the overall scope helped show just how influential this man can be.Feelings- 10/10You know it is a good film when you are walking out of the cinema feeling great, like you just watched the best movie ever. Although this feeling fades, you know that you will want to watch it again. And that's what Days of Future Past does to youOverall- 9.4/10Walking out of the cinema, I was prepared to give a 10. Only thinking about the movie for a good 3 hours saw some minor faults in this film. It is an absolute must see and will rightfully be one of the biggest films of 2014

reviews.review_title: X-Men: Days of Future Past is perfection of the comic book genre; a must see film.
reviews.content: For a movie that has it all (time travel, superheroes, action, all-star cast), Bryan Singer pulls off an impressive woven story that combines the old and younger X-Men together. I'm usually not a fan of Singer, but I walked away thoroughly impressed what he pulled off in this film. Using the trick from the time travel play book of Star Trek, Singer has set up the franchise in a way to bring back all the characters killed off from X-Men: The Last Stand. Yet, this time travel device was unique from anything I've ever seen on film because instead of physically sending someone back in time, their conscious was transported back which restricted who could travel back in time and how long ago they could go. A much younger Whiplash was also a nice dose of action and humor to the film with a action sequence that is up there with the Matrix. With one of the biggest all-star casts ever assembled next to the Avengers, Michael Fassbender shines as Magento once again with true performance that gives life to an otherwise far-fetched plot. James McAvoy returns as the younger Charles Xavier giving an excellent performance as well. However, the reason I gave this movie an 8/10 is because I wasn't wholly satisfied after the credits rolled. The film didn't utilize the powerhouse duo of Patrick Stewart or Ian McKellen. It also didn't establish the present dystopia world in order to rush to the time travel part. The CGI was very mediocre for the Sentinels in the present time and I didn't buy the action. I wish they had attempted more real-life sequences and spent more time setting up the film and giving more thought to the CGI effects. Overall, Bryan Singer hits a home run with this film by giving audiences exactly what they want: a comic book movie that plays like a comic book with stellar performances by Fassbender and McAvoy. A must see film for any comic book fans.

The movie is great! It has been directed very good a very fine job done by the director.The start of the movie even makes it very interesting and the use of latest effects is very good. It is a story about everything love,betrayals,survival and emotions. If you are a X movie fan than this is the real deal for you and i can bet it is the best of all till the date.The thing i loved most about this movie was that they finally considered magneto to show up what he is capable of for real.Hugh Jackman is all time in his best in the movie you will definitely love him.Other characters also played their role to the best and put up a good time. Worth the time and money.

Best movie of 2014 Hands Down, Bryan Singer knows how to make a movie that has everything, Action, Drama, Dialogue, Special Effects, you name it. Not that he does it all by himself, everybody did an amazing job in this movie.This movie delivers a surprising top notch entertaining with a potent story and some good twists that help to live up expectations mixed with terrific special effects and cinematography. 3-D is very cool here.I have watched it 4 times since I bought it. Just Perfect. The scene where Quick Silver is running through the kitchen rearranging the bullets and the federal agents was pure brilliance.

First than anything I have to say it "This is the first Marvel movie I don't hate, indeed I loved it. I actually hate the fact I loved it, this great movie made me forget for a moment how bad marvel can be, (the amazing spider man and the avengers for example). This movie was so original, so entertaining, surprising and also stressful. During the whole movie I was biting my nails, wanting to see what happens next. I went in there expecting less than nothing from i, now I have to say it's one of my favorites. Greatest superheroes movie after batman! What I actually liked the most from this movie is the fact that not even the extremely well payed Hugh Jackman or the incredible Jennifer Lawrence, did such a great role as Evan Peters did by playing Quick Silver. You'll want to be him, believe me.

reviews.review_title: One of the best superhero movies made
reviews.content: I absolutely loved this film. I would give it a 9.5 but can't so a 10 will do as there are only extremely minor flaws to this film most of which are personal to me The story line was great, although not sticking to the original comic story arc it still works well sending wolverine back instead of kitty pride (she was not born in 1973 as she was a teenager in x-men the last stand. The characters were well cast (new faces bishop, warpath, blink and the well played by Peter dinklage:bolivar trask) the old faces of the first trilogy were good to see and Jen law and crew from first class have shown they were good choices to play younger versions!! And not to forget evan peters playing pietro maximoff who stole every scene he was in even from Hugh jackman. To this I find my first flaw in this film maximoff/quicksilver (to which is not referenced in the film) should of had a bigger part to play considering he would of been extremely useful during the Washington scene when the sentinels and magneto we're attacking wolverine and beast. My other personal flaw of the film is the future sentinels they resembled nimrod to much with they're appearance and power set and the trailers which only showed the one future sentinel which got me excited to think that nimrod was the one hunting down the x-men, with the back up from normal sentinels. But I still like the idea of the xmen knowing they're screwed if they went up against these sentinels with hundreds of them after the remaining mutants so using kitty's newly mutated time phasing ability ( to which could of developed anytime between last stand and this for all the people bitching about how she got these new powers remember the future in this film is set in 2023 so there's 17 years between this and last stand ) they protect her while she sends bishops mind back to his body a few days to before the attack so they avoid the sentinel army (while doing this I can imagine the latter getting ripped apart by the sentinels over and over again luckily kitty hasn't failed yet Lol) So all in all despite my own personal little flaws this film is awesome definite recommend even if you ain't a fan of xmen as it's just a great film to watch but if you have little imagination or can't follow time travel story lines then there's no point because you will just think the film is stupid! I have more to say but can't really fit it all in but I will be posting a YouTube review by next week with all my points and those of my close friends as we discuss this movie in more detail as were all massive xmen fans

The X-Men have been laying low over the years after 2006's X-Men: The Last Stand. While The Wolverine emerged in 2013, the X-Men emerged in 2014's best film since Captain America: The Winter Soldier. Set in the dystopian future where humanity is enslaved by robots called the Sentinels, the X-Men send Wolverine back to the past to 1973 to rewrite history and change the franchise for the better. Everyone from the original trilogy and First Class return in an outstanding ensemble cast. Hugh Jackman returns as the Wolverine who is now old, James McAvoy reprises his role as a more broken Charles Xavier, Michael Fassbender further explores his role as the menacing Magneto. The stand out however is Jennifer Lawrence who's portrayal as Mystique is amazing and spectacular to watch. The movie is emotional, eye popping and action-packed with scenes that are unique and a driving story. The second story in the First Class trilogy, X-Men returns to the public with the highly anticipated Deadpool Movie and X-Men: Apocalypse!

reviews.review_title: Probably the best X-Men movie so far
reviews.content: This is probably the best movie in the X-Men franchise. There is a great plot that brings the two worlds (past and present) of the X-Men movies together which means there are a whole bunch of cool characters whose amazing powers are beautiful to watch, especially in tandem. The special effects and fight scenes are awesome and well executed. It has a stellar cast as well, which includes my favorites Hugh Jackman, Jennifer Lawrence, and James McAvoy.It also has the most hilarious scene I have ever seen in any X-Men film; it involves the character Peter (aka Quicksilver). He is in the film for just a short time but he was such a scene stealer (the same way he steals everything else, I now realize). The other scene stealer is Raven (aka Mystique) who has really amazing combat moves. Like, woah.The plot was based on a famous comic book story with the same name, but they had to make some adjustments in order to make it fit with the film universe. For example, in the comics, it was supposed to be Kitty Pryde who gets sent back to the past, but the Kitty Pryde of the movies wasn't even born in 1973. So they realized that it would have to be Wolverine, because he has a mutant healing factor and longevity, which means that the same actor could play him in the past and the future.That said, I don't think you need to watch the other X-Men films in order to enjoy this film, but if you did, it will definitely be more fun for you, as you can understand who the numerous characters are without having to resort to asking your seatmate or having to put up with her reacting to everyone with gasps, namedrops and background stories in hurried confusing whispers (I am the seatmate in this scenario, by the way). You might want to stay put after the credits, as there is a short scene that shows a glimpse of what the next X-Men film will be all about.

reviews.review_title: Days of future past: It didn't make sense then, and it still doesn't!
reviews.content: My summary of the movie:So the X-Men are being hunted down and destroyed by Sentinels – powerful killing machines that can mimic and counter any mutant power. I guess that forces the eternal enemies Professor X and Magneto to work together. Wolverine shows up on the scene as well, all dressed up for the occasion. By the way, they never explained how Professor X was able to re-combobulate himself after being literally blown to smithereens in X3 by a raging Phoenix. By the end of THAT movie he was in another person's body. I felt part was glossed over somehow. What was also glossed over was the fact that Kitty Pride suddenly has the ability to send people back in time (well, in their mind anyway, but the result is pretty much the same.) So she sends Wolverine back in time so that he can stop the pivotal point when the Sentinel program gains the ability to defeat all mutants – that is, when Mystique is captured and her DNA harvested. So Wolverine reluctantly obliges. He is, after all, the best man for the job.
