Getting people to work together is his thing, since he's such a team player himself.So back in 1970's, Wolverine and his bone claws go looking for Professor X, who's doped up on drugs with Beast as his supplier. They decide to break Magneto out of his no-metal prison. (How many times does Magneto end up in those?) To do this, they recruit The Flash to bust into the Pentagon, break out Magneto, so he can get to Mystique, who is out choking men to death with her feet. That's the plan anyway. (Although there doesn't seem to be much of a plan throughout the movie; everyone is just sort of improvising.) On the way, Magneto and the Prof. get into an argument, which almost ends up crushing the plane they're flying in. Thankfully, Mag gets a grip and fixes the plane. Then some really weird stuff happens. Mystique tries to kill a short guy, Mag tries to kill Mystique, Wolverine sees Stryker and gets a panic attack, which sends us back to the future and some more fight scenes between the Sentinels and a big black guy with a big gun, Storm who charges him up with her lightning, and a woman who is from the Portal games.Back in the 70's, Magneto hops on a train with the Sentinels (1970's version) and injects them with metal from the rails so that he could control them. He then continues on his bewildering quest and (literally) picks up an entire baseball stadium and transports it to the White House. He then drags Nixon and his cronies up and out of their bomb shelter to convince them that he's not a threat (or is a threat, I forget). By the end, Mystique is convinced by X not to kill Shorty, which saves the future. Shorty ends up in jail for selling secrets to the US. That's what you get for messing with Nixon. Oh, and Wolverine gets horribly impaled and drowned. But he'll be OK.So finally, back in the future, we see the end of all mutant-kind as the Sentinels pull Colossus apart (again), defeat Flame guy and Iceman, and Magneto gets impaled by a shard of metal of all things. Oh, the irony! And as we watch the destruction, we realize that it never took place at all. Wolverine wakes up at Xavier's school where he has a decent haircut and teaches history. He sees Jean Gray, the love of his life, still alive, which means X3 didn't happen. He goes to touch her, and Cyclops intercedes. Damn. Oh well, he quickly moves on and the movie ends with him and the Prof catching up, since apparently none of the X-Men movies ever really happened.Series rebooted. Congratulations, Bryan Singer. You've destroyed everything you've created. PS: If you stay until after the credits, you'll see a guy building pyramids out of Lego. Many people are worshipping him because, well, it's Lego!
My favorite x men movie, worth watchable.best x men movie.

I haven't seen the Dark Phoenix yet but it can't be worse than this. First of all, if this was a drama movie then it would be outstanding, but this is not what X-Men should be. As an action movie though it's one of the most boring movie ever! Although the movie carries a sentimental value, and the plot is somewhat neeth and clever, absolutely NOTHING happens action wize, which is sad when you concider what a X-Men movie should be. A thrilling, clever, heart thumping, action packed ride with interesting characters showcasing their abilities creatively. Sure, It's always nice to see Wolverine and all our favorite X-men characters on screen, but what's the point if you never get to see them in action? It's like buying a Ferrari for the sake of just watching it with no intention of ever driving it. That's just pathetic and totally waste of time. Steer clear of this stink bomb and watch something else. You can thank me later!

reviews.review_title: So whats new in this movie ?
reviews.content: I went to the theaters after watching the trailers and hoped there would be a fight between the mutants and the sentinels. But instead the movie showed how, mutants were trying to avoid that conflict. That seemed a bit less heroic. And really whats new in this movie, "time travel" .. already over done, "giant robots" .. common, we have seen Pacific Rim. And I don't think anyone noticed, the sentinels resembled the fire gushing iron giant in Thor. Lets talk about action, wolverine without his metal claws, I could not take that. Why did Eric(Magneto) picked up the stadium, I don't have any idea. And the oldies(magneto and professor x) made the movie so boring. Overall I had lots of expectation from the movie. Loved Quicksilver though. He was the only entertaining character in the movie.

I actually loved most of the movie - Until the very end - they decided to erase x-men 1-3 + the wolverine movies in a single stroke and I feel robbed. The fact that Jean Grey is alive just because they managed to kill the centurions, just doesn't make sense - Her powers are to intense to live with and Erik is still full of hate, wanting to kill of the humans, so even without the centurions everything that happened in the first movies should still have happened. Right now we're thinking did Wolverine get his claws - seeing that Mystic pulled him out off the river?? So all in all being a x-men hardcore fan - I'm thinking what the F*** ???

I know this is my first review on a movie. But anyways. i remember going to the movies last month to watch this movie, at the movies. Minutes after the start Here are some things i liked about the movie.1. The acting, The acting was a well done. But i think that Peter Dinklage can do better acting then his acting in this. Anyways. Next2. The producers. I think the producer who did a great job. Was Stan lee. I'm a Stan Lee fan of the movies he works on. Nice work Stan lee.The Casting. I think Bryan Singer was like "Hmmm. Should i get Peter Dinklage or not?. Imma just get him anyway" I guess the Hugh Jackson is never gonna get replaced by anyone. I mean anyone. That is it for the review. If your a huge Marvel fan. I think you should see this. K bye

Very good movie. I was waiting for it since many months. The movie is superb and the wolverine is very good. i liked it very much. Now waiting for next movies of x-Men to be released. In this movie the magneto runs then what will happen in the future. Next parts will be gonna interesting. The effects of the x-men days of future past were good and when the wolverine goes in past there are sentinels and it looks awkward to see the technology which is not present today and there in the past there is such an advanced technology. Although the movie was great. may be we can see aliens in the next parts or a mutant powerful then everyone with ability to do any mutant powers.

reviews.review_title: X Men days of future past
reviews.content: X men, days of future past came to be one of the most anticipated films of this year in the action genre, science fiction, superheroes, has to do. No doubt the experience of seeing this story made into a film represents a milestone, since it is one of the best arguments in terms of comic book made by Marvel factory. At all times the history maintains a logical line of events and consequences for the mutants. The characters are well embedded in the argument and no appearance looks forced or impair the development of the story. In terms of performance, we can see many pleasant things, since they have been delving into this aspect. In fact, the emotional touch and retrospective is more elaborate and detailed than in previous films in the series X. Special effects and the resources actually used serve their purpose. It turns out to be a very good adaptation of the original story, and we can thank all the effort put into this work. Enjoy watching it and I hope that your print is equally good.

Story Over View : Sentinels, robots that were created for the purpose of hunting down mutants were released in 1973. 50 years later the Sentinels would also hunt humans who aid mutants. Charles Xavier and his X-Men try their best to deal with the Sentinels but they are able to adapt and deal with all mutant abilities.My Favor Yeah the movie is great fun with the science fiction and the technology used with the great powers of the characters and what a superb story it is. You people will enjoy a lot watch if you guys haven't watch it before . A spectacular idea about sci fiction movie involving the characters having super natural powers and unleashed powers you guys haven't imagine. I hope You guys will enjoy it.

I would gladly have rated this film as 10 golden stars had it not been for the lack of information supplied. I have so many questions that with thanks to my 'geeky' internet friends, have been resolved.Some of my questions; How the hell is Xavier back alive? Jean tore him apart but sure in this film he's back wheel-chairing as per usual. Suddenly, Ellen Page's character, Kitty Pryde can teleport people's consciousness back through time... A film ago she was running through walls???? What happened???????? Where are the other characters??? We see Bobby and Kitty Pryde and Storm and Magneto and Xavier and Wolverine. But where are the likes of Rogue, the characters from the earlier films? Have they all died?It seemed to me that to only way to follow this film, was to read the comics, a factor which really annoys me about films (to understand something, you have to read the book/comic etc).That being said, this film was jay-dropping. The ending was a brilliant cliff hanger and a plot twist to die for, the graphics were so realistic I swear I have obtained a fear of my local football stadium lifting off, and the plot was just brilliant. I wont even speak of the actors/actresses performances, because lets face it we all are well aware of just how spectacular they all are.

reviews.review_title: Bryan Singer Returns with a Bang!
reviews.content: When Bryan Singer didn't direct X-men 3 and Origins: Wolverine, it was obvious. Frankly, I don't hate them as much as most people, but the flaws are obvious. Singer shows with this movie that he is the best choice for the X-men franchise.James McAvoy and Michael Fassbender do a great job filling the shoes of Patrick Stewart and Ian McKellen as the younger version of their characters. Hugh Jackman is awesome as normal, and Jennifer Lawrence isn't bad as Mystique. Quicksilver is awesome!! The only thing I really didn't like was Wolverines bone claws, but honestly, who does.Young Xavier is really down in life. One could even say he is a junkie, but McAvoy pulls it of very well, which is one of the highlights of this movie.People have said they didn't like it because there wasn't enough action. To those people: the story was done so well that action wasn't needed. If you want to watch an action movie, watch Die Hard.DOFP is by far, the best summer movie so far, and it will be hard to top. 10/10.

This movie can be summarized in a single word: XMEN. From the very beginning of the movie, the XMEN XMEN with the other XMEN, as the XMEN XMEN alongside each each other. XMEN has it all - XMEN loving, XMEN hating, XMEN fighting, XMEN hugging, XMEN smiling and XMEN frowning. And most of all, the XMEN never cease to XMEN. In honor of the XMEN, I would suggest that we offer this XMEN movie a glowing round of applause - since it allows us, too, to XMEN with the XMEN. If I were one of the XMEN, I would join the XMEN and fight against the XMEN haters too, just like the XMEN do in XMEN. However, I have a single problem with XMEN, and it is that, like the other XMEN movies before it, I just wished the XMEN could XMEN more before XMEN was over. XMEN.

The movie was so great as the movie has already released and its been like months after its release but i will still write about how the movie was. It was just awesome an experience that can never be described with words alone.The acting done and actually the movie's time warping at first, I must say that even being the X man for so long doesn't understand what happens when she warped the time. But then after going in more deep and deep into the movie i understood everything.And what works for me best was the website that they created months ago before the movie was going to release The Bent Bullet which explains what happened in the movie actually wasn't shown properly as it was not shown in the movie.So All in all the movie was great. I just watched it almost 10 times but still haven't got bored from watching it.A Full 9 out of 10.

this part is a sequel for X-men (last stand) & first class,,,Bryan singer managed to bring best of all from the characters & script even though for the short time appearance peter/quicksilver character was perfectly used,the scene in pentagon between guards & quicksilver is worth for a watch for at least 20 times,,,Bryan perfectly shot that scene, the visuals are so immensely awesome, script is a bit tricky in this film,time phasing shift between the past & future is worth a puzzle.In this part we will see a new unseen phase in Charles Xavier character never before,,,as-usual magneto is shown extremely powerful,,,mystic is key to this plot in this film. we seem to find the answers for the questions arises in the past trilogy, but unfortunately we follow ourselves with the new queries. after all this is one of the finest X-men ,,, & definitely a must watch for all X-men franchise lovers !!!

reviews.review_title: Just one word - Spectacular, Ten on Ten
reviews.content: Undoubtedly, the best movie of the year.I just saw it few hours back and wanted to see it again right away. This is by far the best X-Men movie as per me. Loved it.All the characters coming together to save their race using time travel, awesome plot. The action scenes where nicely choreographed, Wolverine was as usual the best among the lot, return of Storm and Cyclops. There is everything in this movie and the story really keeps you on the edge of your seat. Also loved Jennifer Lawrence, she is perfect for the character Mystic looks stunning in the action sequences.Will surely watch it again. Go and watch it ASAP. Don't miss it.

I was not happy with the trailer. But when i watched this movie i was like wow... Bryan again proved he is one of the best. I am of the fan of his movie usual suspect. This movie is worth to watch. But keep it mind there will be no Goosebumps action, but the action which is in the movie drive u somewhere. Bryan went this time more of story than action. Brilliant screenplay which will give u a clear picture of what's going instead of confusing what is happening. The way he portrayed every character is awesome. Then about CG is nicely done, giving support to the dark screenplay. There is no much space for Hugh Jackman even though he moves the screenplay. Every one gave his best in their characters. Cinematography is wonderful. The young Charles rocks, and holding the story. There is some humor in the movie which is nicely blended. I could have gave 10 because of climax its 9. I expected more than this. Sorry my bad. Overall its awesome and brilliant from Bryan. Waiting for the sequel.

I have waited for this movie since I watched X Men The Last Stand and finally it happened. Even though X Men The Last Stand was a bad movie, I had to take a chance on this. "Bryan Singer Comes Back To Freaking Direct" and i am excited as I wonder how would he fix this wrecking franchise...............and well he did. It didn't actually fix it, the movies wasn't changed but he made an impossible feat making the 4th movie the best one yet and answering all the question the last 6 movies had left. If you aren't a big fan of this or you haven't seen all the previous movies I advise you not to watch it because it will displease you. This movie is meant for the X Men fans. Who makes a fourth prequel sequel movie on a wrecked franchise?, no one... except for Bryan Singer. With Matthew Vaughn's movie X Men First Class I knew that Bryan had "HOPE" (you would understand if you seen the movie)so he agreed to make off another movie interconnecting these the old wrecked trilogy with a successful prequel and well he chose the most cliché way and its time travel. ( Based From Days of Future Past Comics)Don't mistake this movie like a Back to the Future sort of thing, changing the past to change the outcome of the future, this movie is like that on some way but it gives us more than any movie has to give. It gives us satisfaction nostalgia and relief, this movie gives as a remedy to stop regretting and stop thinking of the past on an unfinished trilogy with a devastating end. I believe everyone was devastated on X Men The Last Stand. Mystique Rogue Juggernaut Professor X Magneto Scott Jean Grey all died or lost their powers. Bryan Singer wants to finish it with a bang, something that many franchises failed miserably and many franchises failed to make, one example is the Sam Raimi's Spiderman Trilogy. And well Bryan Singer pulled it off.The movies is set in the future where mutants are killed by Sentinels (with Mystique like powers) made by Trask who was killed by Mystique, 50 years ago which started everything. Wolverine gets sent to the past to change the future with the help of Kitty and the other surviving mutants. He wakes naked and starts finding Charles which is a total wreck. He was using the drug Hank made from X Men First Class to stop mutation thus making him walk but in exchange losing his mental powers. Wolverine tries to persuade him to stop Raven but he can't without Magneto's help. Magneto is locked in the pentagon for killing JFK. Wolverine and the gang tries to find Maximoff or Quicksilver to help escape his daddy which wasn't mentioned or showed explicitly in the film. He escapes then the group try to stop the assassination but Magneto the "a""hole" fixes it his own way now wanting to kill Mystique. Its up to Charles to save the future. ( I won't spoil too much of the ending because reading it won't give it justice you need to watch this movie)It isn't mind boggling like the Usual Suspects, It isn't a movie that was based on a single book like Shawshank Redemption, It isn't movie really interconnected to each other pretty well with the sequels and prequels like Godfather. It isn't perfect for God's Sake. So people don't try to make it complicated. If you like X Men: Watch it. If you don't like it: Don't watch it. If you haven't seen X Men movies or all of it then watch it first before you watch this to experience the full satisfaction, enjoyment, nostalgia and to fully understand it. The cameos of character like the older Hank, Rogue, Jean and Scott, the old actors and new actors from past and future reuniting in this Marvel movie seems fitting to end this franchise. I won't contradict if there will be a new one but his movie is enough to end this franchise. Well ONe LAst THing, If you just gonna watch this just for Wolverine or any one X MEn then forget about it because you won't be happy. This movie showcases every mutant in equal ways so no highlights but Quicksilver is just steals the spotlight even in his short appearance.

I REALLY LOVED THIS MOVIE! The only reasoning I gave it a 8 is because it felt short, I felt like something was missing. It had a few problems, like all movies do, but I really love it. The title, the story, and the flow were all on point. I wish we could have seen more of Quicksilver because his scene was my favorite. But, at the end the was very satisfied and I will definitely be watching this movie over and over again.This is a movie that fans and non-fans of the franchise will really enjoy. This is without a doubt, the BEST X-MEN movie IN THE ENTIRE FRANCHISE. If you have never seen an X-Men movie, have not desire to, or you're a fan who is a little disappointed in the previous X-Men movies I suggest you go watch this one. You will not be disappointed, I promise. This movie is worth every minute of your time. If IMDb did letter grades I would give this movie a B+.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the best comic book of all time
reviews.content: X-Men: Days Of Future Past' serves as a sequel to both critically acclaimed 'X-Men: First Class', and 'X-Men: The Last Stand' which was a decent X-men film. Now being a huge X-men fan I was extremely excited when I heard this sequel was announced. I enjoyed the new direction in First Class and the last of the trilogy in Last Stand. That being said, what it being the return of the old 'X-Men' cast, and I being also familiar with the 'Days Of Future Past' comic I was already expecting it to be another good movie in the franchise, but it turns out not only was 'Days Of Future Past' the best X-Men movie yet, it's possibly the best comic-book movie ever made.
Half of the film is not bad. Another half is totally boring.. Overrated movie.

reviews.review_title: Well, This is a whole new level!
reviews.content: The 7th movie in the X-Men franchise, X-men Days of Future Past, is a Major and Fresh entry in this Dying Franchise, X-men is a the oldest on going franchise of superhero movies. The X-Men series lost its touch since the X-Men : The Last Stand, which was a major disaster, including the stand alone spin-off movies of Wolverine, the franchise started sinking, until X-Men First Class came, which served a origin story or Prequel for the whole franchise, and was a success. Now Days of Future Past continues the story from both "The Last Stand" and "First Class". Based on the Comic Book with the same name, the movie stays loyal to the Comic book story line to some extent.The Movie Starts with the Dystopian future where machines named "Sentinels" have started a war against Mutants and Humans who help Mutants, Most of the X-Men have died and only few are left, and the only way to stop the war is going back to past and change the course of history. So Wolverine is sent back and the struggle to change the past for saving the future begins.The future part of the movie has a very dark tone, The fear of sentinels and their power to destroy the mutants can be felt all along, the viewer also feels the fear knowing how strong the sentinels are, whereas the Past portion is kind of normal and fun, yes "Fun" ,there is Humor in the Past portion.The Biggest USP of the Movie is the Characters, all the "Alive" characters of the Franchise united, that is fun to watch,personally i was excited about watching Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Hugh Jackman sharing the screen together after such a long time. Jennifer Lawrence, Micheal Fassbender, James McAvoy, Halle Berry were a treat to watch. Again as i always have said that i focus on characters of the Film. But Peter Dinklage was wasted in the movie, his Character "Bolivar Trask" , the creator of Sentinels was unclear and confused.The characters of the film are very well used, all the mutant's powers were shown effectively and each of them had something important to do in the movie, but 1 character literally steals the show, "Quicksilver". When the character posters were revealed , "Quicksilver" was highly criticized and hated by all,because of his look in the movie, but as it turns out, he has the best scene in the whole franchise till date, setting an example of , do not judge a book by its cover, or do not judge a character from his poster! Professor Xavier or Professor X, both the future one and past one have a vast difference between them which is shown quite well , Magneto too had many different sides of him, he is evil but has respect for his best-friend too, personally Micheal Fassbender is an Awesome Magneto, of-course cannot beat Ian McKellen but still pretty good. watching Hugh Jackman is always a pleasure, and Jennifer Lawrence as Mystique is a total Enjoyment, she is flawless! Overall the movie is quite complicated as it has the time-travel element , but Bryan Singer did a great job by explaining it very well to the viewers, of-course there are some confusions at some point, but those can be ignored, i loved Bryan's "The Usual Suspects", but i hated him since "Superman Returns",cause he ruined it. But once again he Gained my trust.The Action is really good, the visual effects, the action choreography is excellent, the action with sentinels is quite intense. Some scenes which moves the plot forward are very touching, Patrick Stewart's speech to younger Charles Xavier is quite emotional, the story moves in a fast pace, from the very start the act begins and movie already picks up speed without wasting any time, performances by the lead actors is very good, such big cast , the biggest cast ever assembled , if i say, is treated equally,and is important in the story as well. The blending of Future elements with Past Elements is done brilliantly.So, X-Men Days of Future Past is definitely a Epic Movie, I personally loved the movie very much, as I am a fan of all Superhero movies, But the reason i loved the movie was the last scene , the last scene made me emotional, you will see why I am saying that, when you watch the movie, The movie worked as a reset button for the X-Men Franchise, giving high hopes to fans for Future Projects.This is a Must Watch! for all the Marvel, X-Men fans out there, and if you are going to watch the movie, if you haven't seen any X-Men movies, you are going to have a bad time, so please watch all the X-men movies before going into theater, Please.P.S : Please stay until the "End-Credits Scene".

this last decade, movies like these have been all about special effect, grand missions and strong emotional moments. They began to center around protagonists going far beyond their own strength and capabilities to defeat the evil. (think Wolverine in the 3nd X-men movie).There are a thousand and one traps and cliché's that movies can fall into, and this one has avoided them all. I was blown away by the depth, the strength and the storytelling in this installment of the X-men. no over the top bad guys, no grand hero defying moments, but a story showing a maturity not shown a lot in these movies.sometimes I felt that the actors were sort of mellow and could be a bit more emotional about the situation, but other than that... wow, just wow

I really enjoyed this movie. So far this movie beats out Godzilla and Amazing Spider-Man 2 by a landslide. The acting done by James McAvoy is simply top notch. Michael playing as Magneto was alright, didn't really like his character in this one. I do have some quips about this movie though, Warpath is simply useless as a fighter. He does nothing to slow down any of the sentinels, why even give him more screen time than say Iceman or sunspot. They also took away from Blinks abilities. Blink can do more than just open up portals, she can also teleport people and objects as well as parts of people. From the looks of things, she seems to be the only one capable of actually damaging the sentinels, when the portal closed it cut off the arm of the sentinel. Meaning if the director was true to marvel universe, she would've been able to do more damage. Also when did Kitty Pryde obtain a new power? Still over all a good movie, I didn't enjoy the previous x-men movie but did enjoy first class and now this.

I've been watching all superheroes movies, starting from Superman, Batman, Dark Knight Trilogy, X-Men, The Avengers, and I could say that this movie is among the best if not the best. The Avengers of Marvel Studios I would say! Jennifer Lawrence shows that she is truly a gem, who can acts and fights too! Michael Fassbender as usual, acts with style while James McAvoy continues his outstanding performance since I first saw him in Wanted. Peter Dinklage act of coolness in this movie could't escape my comparison of him as Tyrion Lannister. Director Bryan Singer and screenwriter Simon Kinberg seems to have studied and understand the benefits or lack of previous X-Men movies. Every wow factor was redoubled and bigger too! The best movie of 2014 so far.

X-men had introduced the franchise. X-men 2 was a worthy sequel. But after flops like "the last stand" and a passable reboot like "first class" i'll admit i had my concerns about this movie. Hugh jackman had left the franchise to focus on other projects and the latest film didn't work as well as it's predecessors. The formula seemed to be use one character to carry the story and use the other characters to give the lead someone to work off of. Much like a lead singer and a team of back up vocalists. Despite the films claiming to be about a team, they never felt like an ensemble piece the avengers franchise has managed.This film came closer than any other to being about the team. The film begins in a dystopian future 2023 where a few free mutants are running and hiding from machines called sentinels that are designed to hunt down and kill anything that doesn't present as baseline human. In a desperate gamble to undo the entire war they have been losing, they send wolverine back in time to stop the event that triggers the whole war of humans vs mutants.From this point on we follow wolverine in 1973 as he attempts to re-unite a younger professor x and magneto in the past while the future 2023 team has to fight off the attacking sentinels to buy him enough time to get the job done.With bryan singer returning as director, actors hugh jackman (wolverine) sir patrick stewart (professor x) and sir ian mckellan (magneto) this movie serves as a sequel to the original x-men movies and the new x-men movies by tying up the two timelines and in essence "ret-conning" the damage done by brett ratner's "the last stand". While at the same time properly helping the new cast with a proper "passing of the torch". Actors james mcavoy (professor x) and michael fassbender (magneto) finally get play the parts they were hired for by showing the audience their characters damaged friendship while still remaining true to their own convictions.The story telling is top notch, the acting is spot on and the special effects compliment the film beautifully at every turn. This film is quite possibly the best in the franchise and leaves the audience with a sense of hope for future x-men movies

In X-Men:Days of Future Past, we experience a totally different superhero movie. In the ordinary superhero movies, the plot is always the same. There is a boy that suffers some transformations and falls in love with a girl. At the end of the movie he has to defeat a villain. However in X-Men:Days of Future Past there is only one villain. The time. The plot of the movie is about sending Wolverine to the past, so that he can change the history.Great actors that play amazing roles, great plot and great visual effects make this movie one of the best superhero movies of all time. In my opinion this movie is one of the favorite candidates to the Oscars of best sound editing, best sound mixing and best visual effects.

One thing that stood out for me was that Dinklage was simply a bad guy.No comedy about his size, no mention of it even. He was just one more excellent actor cast in a decent (Tho could have been deeper) role. I take my hat off for that.

reviews.review_title: Why X-Men missed its potential Avengers moment
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past Review SPOILER ALERT The X-Men franchise has always produced good movies, and X-Men: Days of Future Past is now included. The film was simply a great movie and I am granting it a full B rating. This was not "The Avengers" by any means which receives an A++.Definitely a buy-able movie of course, and with the Quicksilver scene at the Pentagon, it is a movie that will easily hit the 100 views on my BluRay player.Quicksilver turns out to be the breakout superhero in this movie but for some strange reason, they decided not to have the character with the X-Men after Magneto was freed. This does not make any sense whatsoever. Quicksilver would have been pivotal in every scene after Magneto's freedom, to include eliminating some scenes that were just too stupid and NOT Comic Book accurate.Sure Magneto is a bastard, but he's not an idiot. He knew how sensitive the situation was with Mystique and stopping her, but no he needs to be a complete idiot. Idiot Magneto not only screws up the plot but engages the X-Men on a "Whose Got the Bigger Penis" game. Professor X being a whinny little bearded retard did not do well for the movie either.The only characters of the movie that didn't screw anything up were Wolverine and the humans. Wolverine can't do bad since its Hugh Jackman that controls him despite whatever the director says. I can't say that for the other characters and actors.The Beast with his on/off powers was such an Anti-subject plot that anyone who read the comics should have been repulsed at that. It was almost like the Beast had the same control problem as the Hulk. You can't engage another characters storyline simply by saying "oh yeah, I take a shot and only change into the Beast when I get angry or when I say Simon Says". That was a Bullshit maneuver on the movie decision makers. They should have kept Beast as Beast! End of Story! Mystique was again awesome! Jennifer Lawrence is beautiful and amazing. Jennifer is definitely the better of the two ladies that have played the character. I hope she continues her Mysterious role as this amazing mutant anti hero.Although the character of Trask was not short in the book, Peter Dinklage does not shorten the role at all. He is strong and solid in every scene, including the scene during his office visit, aka Mystique moment.The Sentinels were scarier in this movie than they ever were in the book. The context of the end of mutant kind was a sincere tone throughout the movie, yet the mutants that were so amazing introduced without names – died without names. To introduce characters to kill them is OK but at least allow the audience to connect with them in some way like giving them names a short back story, something to justify their demise. But no, they did not. I give this movie a solid B and look forward to the next installment to the X-Men franchise.

A good movie but I expected better. Would I say it blew the previous X-Men movies out of the water? No. It doesn't have that "punch" like Man of Steel did (THE Best so far). The story line is OK. If you've seen the other X-Men movies, it is very similar in style. Somewhat slow pace then it picks up. Nothing unusual or exciting except short battle clips with the Sentinels. Not enough juice to knock people out. I'm sure DC Comics has gotten Marvel to think harder and come up with a better challenge. So far DC Comics has gotten a new fan; I anticipate a killer Batman vs. Superman smash in 2016. In short, would I watch this X-Men Days of Future Past again? hmmm...I can live without it.

Is too bad that producers of all x-men movies have always included profanity and nudity not suitable for younger viewers in the family. All other movies with marvel characters (by other producers) are more family friendly. It's been proved that Hollywood does better with movies by marvel when movies are made suitable for all ages. I thought that after the first or second x-men movie, the producers would get it....but sadly they just don't. I have hesitated to rent the x-men movies because it is way too uncomfortable to have little ones watch something unsuitable for them. I know that some other marvel movies are rated pg-13 too, but that's usually for intense action.

reviews.review_title: X-Men: Days of Future Past succeeds at being a thrilling and fun superhero movie, balanced by well-earned dramatic weight.
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past combines the best elements of the series to produce a satisfyingly fast-paced outing that ranks among the franchise's finest installments. X-Men: Days of Future Past is by far the most ambitious film in the franchise an attempt to take the entire six-film saga and all of the notorious continuity errors that come with it and soft-reboot it via a story that is both character drama and spectacle, meant to honor both the Original Trilogy and First Class halves of the franchise. Against all odds, Singer manages to deliver all of the above, resulting in the best X-Men movie to date, and a comic book movie that could arguably be placed in the company of the genre's elite. It is with a sad note of irony that, on a directorial level, Bryan Singer has delivered his best film ever. Days of Future Past is a showcase of directorial talent, to the point that it is arguably a handful of well-crafted movies, woven together. The futuristic sci-fi world and mutant action sequences are awesome spectacle, while the future Sentinels are dark, frightening creatures; the '70s period piece is colorful, gleefully retro, and well-staged in nearly every scene; and there's an excellent character drama at the film's core, utilizing great actors who deliver performances above and beyond expectations of the genre.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely Amazing, this is what the X-men movie should have been from the get go.
reviews.content: I think they finally found the right director for this series. X-men First class was probably the first X-men movie that I felt was done right for the first time. I've been a comic book fan for 25 years, and I have to say, this movie and X-men first class are now the standard to what a good comic book movie should be, (save maybe Batman Trilogy which is amazing) This movie was action packed, and showed the dearth of emotions that one goes through while reading the comics, it really does capture the parts of what makes a comic book story so compelling, and i felt that this movie finally was able to capture what makes a comic book such a great story telling medium. The fact that this director is able to take the best of the comic book feel and put it on screen is breathtaking. I literally was smiling in the middle of this movie,cause it felt like I was watching a masterpiece of art, that finally gotit correct... X-men first class was already so impressive to me, and then they gave me this.. its a bit of a different story from the comic bookversion of Days of Future past, but it really does a fantastic job recreating the gist of it, and wrapping up all the previous movies into this one. and basically restarting the franchise correctly. All Hail Bryan Singer and his crew for bringing us comic fans this masterpiece. Please keep him around for a long time as this director knows what he is doing. I'd sign a long term contract with him asap. Cannot wait for the next movie.

Honestly I've been into x-men movies since first class, my uncle told me "lets go and watch this new movie! shall we?" i was 7 years old. Since then I've been obsessed with x-men. This movie had everything all fans love. it had quicksilver, lots of plot twists, young Xavier and magneto, basically gorgeous movie. we saw mystique like a Badass, we saw wolverine traveling in time, etc. I loved the action in lots of action scenes. I loved the sentinels. all was brought to life so good, nearly as good as the comic, movie chemistry 10/10, loved the relationship between Xavier and Erick. i was hoping so badly to see quicksilver, and there he was. finally we got Bryan singer and we trashed Brett Ratner. actual good excuse to delete x-men the last stand from the movies! actually i have the doubt if actually some characters are going to die in apocalypse.

Many fans think that Days of Future Past is the best in the franchise, but I have a different opinion. Yes, it was still a great film, but it was pretty slow compared to the films prior to Future Past. A bit too much drama in a superhero film to me, but when it did have action it was great. Like everyone else, my favorite part was when after Wolverine, Beast, Professor X, and Quicksilver break out Magneto from the Pentagon the latter went into, like, hyper-mode and was just rearranging all the soldiers and their weapons so that they couldn't get caught and imprisoned. The beginning was pretty thrilling and suspenseful as well, when Kitty Pryde barely got Bishop back in time to warn the team that the Sentinels (anti-mutant robots developed by Bolivar Trask in the 70's) knew where their location was. For those who have become really attached to the characters and get emotional easily, the scene where the Sentinels wipe out the X-Men from the future can be upsetting. First, Storm gets impaled by a Sentinel climbing up a cliff and tossed over the edge, and then everything falls apart from there. The Sentinels then shoot energy beams at Bishop, who, like the Extremis soldiers in Iron Man 3, absorbs too much energy and eventually explodes. Blink tries her best to hinder the Sentinels, but three of them stab her simultaneously (one in the back, two in the side). Colossus gets ripped in half (from his torso) and Sunspot is impaled. Warpath has his face burnt off. Magneto survives, but is mortally impaled by a piece of metal shrapnel. Overall, the film's tone is pretty dark but there are some funny parts. Great movie, just a bit slow.

A good film and one that proves the superhero genre isn't stale yet...or maybe it's just the X-Men, who in comic book runs have had favorable arcs & interesting character development, along with Bryan Singer's expertise in juggling it all that makes these films attractive even to superhero haters. "X-men: Days" tells us a tale of a doomed future where our mutant friends face extinction. Their hope lies in Ellen Page's character Kitty that can transfer consciences back in time, that conscience would be the Wolverine (apparently he's the only one that can survive the journey to 1972), so the young Charles can stop Mystique from killing Peter Dinklage who's the "MacGuffin" or plot goal here.... If you think about it, it makes no sense & it sounds ridiculous...but somehow this turns out to be glorious in all it's time-hopping, special effects blazing wonder. Much credit to the actors who by now are comfortable in their roles, seeing both old & new cast was wonderful. James McAvoy carries the movie, along with wondrous Quicksilver scene. Even Jennifer Lawrence isn't annoying because she was nice side role. I am worried they'll give her too big a part in "Apocalypse" but that's Hollywood I guess.Cinematography is excellent & CGI is one of the best I've seen. It's easy to get effects fatigue with all these mutants running around like what happened in "X-Men: Last Stand" but Singer makes it all look top notch. Music was good, I felt invested & hoped for a good outcome. I shed a tear seeing Famke Janssen at the end, it was a sly way to get Jean Grey backA fun movie, you don't need to know your X-Men to enjoy a good blockbuster here, recommended for all movie lovers.

reviews.review_title: Mutants, we now find ourselves on the edge of extinction.
reviews.content: The X-Men are back! And this time, they have to fight in the past to change the future. In a dystopian 2023, mutants are being hunted down by machines called Sentinels. A small band of survivors (including former X-Men Kitty, Iceman, and Colossus) unite with the X-Men and Magneto to end the war. They send Wolverine's consciousness, who is the only one who can physically survive it due to his healing factor, to his younger body to warn the younger versions of Xavier, Hank McCoy, and Magneto of the future war and convince the young Mystique to not assassinate the creator of the Sentinels, Bolivar Trask, because doing so will trigger the anti-mutant movement and the creation of the Sentinels. Packed with action, thrills, great acting, excitement, and themes of hope, X-Men: Days Of Future past is one of the best movies of the summer of 2014. I saw this movie twice and I cannot wait till the Blu Ray release.

Once again, sorry if I post this with a broken English. I decide to write the review in Bahasa Indonesia and then translate it with google translate.Watching this film brought a brief message: sacrifice. Are we willing to sacrifice our ambitions for the noble purpose?1. This is a story about Mystique's choice, whether she should revenge or sacrifice for the future of mutans and human?2. This is the story of the mutans: they are united and willing to sacrifice himself in order to save the future which they rely on the hands of one of their friends. 3. This is a story about the wolferine. I can finally understand the story since the first movie to the last in Japan. He living in a nightmare; but he was willing to let it go for the future the better living of mutans and human being.Two thumbs up for the director and the people behind the birth of this film: they can recycle the story of the X-Men, without should get out of the storyline.And, as always: Hugh Jackman is the best!! Regards Narareba

reviews.review_title: A good movie for family viewing
reviews.content: X-men: Days of Future Past is probably the best X-Men movie to date. Although the plot isn't entirely traceable, chronologically this film would be the second of the new X-Men trilogy. The war has been fought over the years, and this film makes use of time travel. Wolverine travels back in time to prevent the current disaster happening in their timeline, and it's brilliant. You meet actors from the future and the present, which I like because it's inclusive. You also meet the real Quicksilver, not that random dude who couldn't dodge a bullet in "The Avengers" when he's going the speed of sound! A perfectly executed Marvel superhero movie from sony/fox. Better than most Avengers movies, in my personal opinion, although I know it's not the most popular.

reviews.review_title: Greatest X-Men movie yet! Maybe best Marvel movie yet.
reviews.content: It, for the most part, stays true to the comics. There are a few discrepancies. But, even the 90's cartoon everyone loves altered the story a little.The acting was phenomenal. The mutant powers shined. The threat felt real. There was just enough of a blend between some well placed jokes and high level tension to balance the film.For those concerned about continuity, DoFP does an excellent job of tying all of the X films together. It does lead to the possibility of alternative universes, but, so does every comic ever made.In short, this is a must see. -From a lifelong X-Men/Marvel fan.

Wow.. this movie was amazing. It was deep and mature instead of just an action-packed CGI fest. Nothing wrong with the Avengers either.. but not every comic book movie needs to be dumbed down for the low sloping foreheads who just want non-stop senseless action with no depth. I think it was ballsy to sacrifice lots of action for some actual story and substance in a summer movie like this. I wish more comic book movies would go in this direction. Everyone has seen all the big CGI tricks now. We get it. We are over it. Now give us something deep. Gives us a good story. Give us something to think about. Give us a reason to watch the movie again. This film does this.Definitely worth a watch if you are prepared to listen and think. If you just want Avengers-style action/comedy then you might be disappointed.

I've always loved time travel movies. This is by far one of the best time travel movies I've ever seen. It's partially actual truth, and partial fantasy as what the X-Men want to change is pretty close to the truth in relation to the last 60 years in the United States. Of course, Jennifer Lawrence character is the most fun to watch as she transforms into numerous other characters. Recently, she said on the tonight show that she has some sort of blue on her skin about 4 months out of the year. The special effects are superb! Nothing is done cheaply in this movie. I've always loved good science fiction, and this is a real good one. I've seen all the previous X-Men movies, and this one is easily the best. Their is a lot of screen time for Jennifer Lawrence so if your a big fan of hers I'm certain you will love this movie. I first saw her in "Winter's Bone", and she was great in that movie. Then, it was shortly after that her star rose. Hugh Jackman is the first one to go back in time because he is the only one of the X-Men that has the chemistry to work with the time travel mechanism. Some of the moments where he struggles staying stabilized between the past and present are pretty tense moments where you find yourself hoping nothing bad will happen to him. I thought picking Nixon as the President to change was a good choice as badly as he handle running the country in real life. This is real a must see movie!

reviews.review_title: -Men: Days of Future Past combines the best elements of the series
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past combines the best elements of the series to produce a satisfyingly fast-paced outing that ranks among the franchise's finest installments. Wolverine gets lots of camera time, visual effects look stunning, the time-travel theme is intriguing -- though sometimes confusing - and HOPE emerges as the film's appealing message. Blockbuster films so often blow so much of their budget on special effects but think of the plot as an afterthought. This one dares to reverse that mistake by investing heavily in its writing and allowing CGI to perfectly complement it.t's that kind of movie: knowledgeable, emotional, and packed with incident and excitement.It's more enjoyable than the other blockbuster action super-hero films that have been released so far this summer.one of the best X-Men movies ever made

reviews.review_title: X-men: Days of Future Past, Days of the future of comic-books film.
reviews.content: This is not a review, it's just my impression.What more can i say? This movie is Extremely amazing, the best movie in the saga, maybe the best movie of the year and one of the greatest comic-based film, is great as The Dark Knight and i dare to say that it's better than The Avengers (at least to me.)Quicksilver was fkng awesome despite his different look to the one in the comics, the only bad thing was that he only appears on screen for just 15 or 20 minutes, although, those minutes were one of the greatest minutes in the entire film.Every structure of the movie is amazing, the screenplay, soundtrack, Dialogue, acting, camera takes, everything!!!PD: Sorry for my bad English.

reviews.review_title: Best Movie of all X-MEN series up to date
reviews.content: Fantastic movie i loved each and every moment i was so happy to watch the special preview on 22nd May evening itself.Bryan Singer really did a good job, the direction,screenplay,background music everything was perfect a flawless movie each and every minute i was at the edge of the seat tensed expecting what's gonna happen next and every scene was unpredictable awesome story hats off to all the cast and crew members for giving us such a wonderful movie each and every summer marvel gives us a blockbuster treat like this and i'm waiting for the next sequel of this movie hope it comes soon.Watch it in 3D guys its rocking................gonna watch it second time.............

reviews.review_title: X-Men: Days of Future Past succeeds at being a thrilling and fun superhero movie.
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past in the first part of the movie mutants travel through time and discovered a near-future in which both mutants and humans have been decimated by deadly killing machines known as The Sentinels. In this nightmarish period, Professor X and his "old friend" Magneto gather the most powerful surviving X-Men together for a effort to stop the Sentinel war: altering the past so that it never happened in the first place. That plan requires Kitty Pryde sending Wolverine's consciousness back into his 1970s body, in order to stop an event that forever sets history on the course of a dark future. But things are bleak in the past, as well the relationship between young Charles Xavier, Magneto and Mystique were all damaged .The events of the Cuban Missile Crisis (seen in X-Men: First Class) have already inspired the beginnings of the Sentinel program; and with every passing moment in the future, the Sentinels get closer to eliminating the last of the X-Men and destroying all hope of altering history.At the center of this desperate mission lie some big questions: Can history be altered, or is destiny set in stone? And can Wolverine play the role of mentor to his own mentor in time to repair some very broken people and save two time lines?On a directorial level, Bryan Singer has delivered his best film ever. Days of Future Past is a showcase of directorial talent .The futuristic world and mutant action sequences are awesome spectacle, while the future Sentinels are dark, frightening creatures; the '70s period piece is colorful, gleefully retro, and well-staged in nearly every scene; and there's an excellent character drama at the film's core, utilizing great actors who deliver performances above and beyond expectations. Like the direction, the script combines eclectic elements into a fine blend.Then again, it's hard to complain about which characters are present or what state they're in when the cast of actors is delivering strong performances. Hugh Jackman leads the once again, but manages to be an effective team player this time. His performance is much more restrained, drawing on Wolverine's extensive history in the previous movies to create an interesting spin on the character as an older and wiser mentor. The First Class squad – Charles Xavier, Magneto, Mystique and Beast – deliver even more of the best elements to this film.In the end, X-Men: Days of Future Past succeeds at being a thrilling and fun superhero movie, balanced by well-earned dramatic weight. It does manage to distill the best parts of the series and use them to push things forward into a fresh start, where fans can forget sins of the past and once again feel optimistic about the notion of X-Men movies.Nofel Saad

First of all, many thanks to the director Bryan Singer who again directed the X-men franchise after a hiatus of a decade. X-men Days Of Future Past succeeds over its prequels which had some flaws in it. The main characters are well defined in this multistarrer movie. Jennifer Lawrence's character Mystique had more screen space this time. James McAvoy and Michael Fassbender both did incredible job reprising their roles as younger Charles and Eric respectively.Veteran actors Patrick Stewart and Ian McKellen played their part well. Their presence added weight to the screen. Among other actors Peter Dinkage was noticeable who was seen in a new role after portraying as Tyrion Lannister in HBO's Game Of Thrones. And finally, our clawed hero Logan aka Wolverine Hugh Jackman looked bigger with his sturdy torso.A couple of things I noticed is Logan wore sunglasses which is unusual and had his signature hairstyle as he had in X- men trilogy films. A must watch for X- men movie fans. P.S. - Hope that more swashbuckling sequels of X-men will release soon.

reviews.review_title: A really good film, but somethings could be added
reviews.content: This review contains spoilers. There will be warning before each spoiler. This is my honest review and is my opinion, this does not mean it is the correct view if wish to disagree and debate my arguments I am willing to listen to other views. please be careful of spoilers. thnx. :) I personally enjoyed this film I loved the plot, the characters, the actors and most importantly the acting. Compared other x-men films I have never been so hyped as I was for one of them But that was a big problem I will never do again. There are some minor problems for me. (This contains a minor spoiler)First problem I had with the film is in the past there are too few x- men. This is a problem for me as I thought the X-men from the previous film X-men First Class (Havok, Banshee, Angel etc...) didn't get enough screen time in the film. This annoyed me because I thought they were going play bigger role and I thought it would have been better with them in it. My second problem would be that there are simply not enough battles. This comes to be a rather annoying problem as I was expecting magneto and his followers, Xavier and the earlier gen x-men with a few sentinels. But the reality is that most of the film is talking, usual superhero film encouragement monologues and usual superhero disagreements.Conclusion: Pro's: 1. Good plot 2. Good actors and characters (especially Jenifer Lawrence as mystique) 3. They managed to make a simple film out of complex concept. Cons: 1. Not enough battles 2. Not enough mutants 3. Ending felt like most other super hero films. 4. The film is over hyped. Please if you are really excited for the film I would tone down your expectations. I was mad for this film and I enjoyed it loads but the problems that I have pointed out (above)lower my rating.(Note: I did point that this review may contain spoiler and there would be warnings but if you find one that I haven't pre-warned you of please don't hesitate to point it out so others don't have it spoiled.)

Review Score - 7/10To quote another beloved reviewer's opening lines, I just watched X-Men: Days of Future Past last night and it was thankfully better than godzilla. It's not a great film but for what it's worth it balances the story pretty well. I'm a fan of superheros and their superpowers and you definitely get some great moments and new characters introduced here that show off what people love about X-Men, especially in the opening which was a good way to introduce the film. The standout here was Quicksilver who really provided a likability and genuine humour to his character. The special fx was great in the film and the storyline wasn't too difficult to follow but entertaining enough to enjoy. It's cast very well and the emotional grips between Charles and Eric keep the film going. The villains here were really the sentinels and I think they nailed their part in showing of how brutal they are which is exactly what they needed to be.The things that didn't work in the film come down to some plot inconsistencies and choices. You have quicksilver who was the most likable character and after his sequence his done, he's reduced down to nothing for the rest of the film. Like really? Firstly, having him not only makes it more entertaining but it also would provide more logical sense than bringing beast. The guy can essentially slow down time and would essentially make a lot of the conflicts non-existent in the way their played out. I'm not saying that having him there is always going to make any problem an easy fix but it seems a bit lazy not coming up with a scenario where that is the case, even at the end you could have magneto bringing him down by controlling the metal that's on his clothes. And when Magneto is gunning to kill Raven, he shoots her in the leg well knowing that her blood is going to be spilled and collected anyways if he killed her makes the whole point of killing her useless. And lastly I know I'm being nitpicky but they're several times where the remote that detects mutants which happens to be standing several feet next to mutants doesn't go off?! Really?It's clear Singer decided to throw out some of the logical sense of the film (especially when you're trying to think back of when events that happened in previous films take place) and that's what takes a bit out of a great rating. Nonetheless, it's an enjoyable ride and still a good film.

reviews.review_title: The best superhero film since The Dark Knight
reviews.content: I heard that this movie was very good but did not know what to expect going in to the theater with 3 friends. Immediately, I was taken away by the film's fight sequences and special effects. The acting was outstanding and the score was perfect. The movie was intense and an edge-of-your-seat experience. The story was amazing, and the writing was up to par. There was one sequence in the film that will likely go down in history as one of the best of all time. This movie is by far the best I have seen this year and I may even go to see it again. I don't think that I can think of one mistake in this film. Every little detail in this film was worked on, and don't forget to stay until after the credits. After all, it's a Marvel film we're talking about.

Finally!! a sequel that surpasses its predecessor.when i first saw X MEN:FIRST CLASS,i though OK,there is movie that is tough to beat,everything about the movie was excellent, the story, the performances,the editing,so on and so forth.But believe you me when i say this,DAYS OF.. is no less,or even better.there is that crisp storyline,where even thought the time line is fractured,it is not at all confusing,and the editing is fantastic.there are the performances par excellence by all the usual suspects in place,and there is my new favorite x man character,quicksilver.there is an amazing 2 minute shot in the movie with multiple cameras that i found was totally worth the price of admission (which in India is only 2.5$ for an i max theater,yeah.)i could ramble on without stopping forever,but didn't somebody say that a single photo snap is worth 10,000 words ? so do yourself a favor,and see it if you haven't already,see it again with friends if u have already seen it.

reviews.review_title: Can't understand this part till now
reviews.content: in wolverine movie Logan loses his power of healing also returns to his natural form his claws returns again to bones not metal . how come in days of future part his claws from metal that he is already lost ?? can't understand this part till now .. but really I liked this movie so much deserves 10/10 if I was understanding this part so anyone can explain that for me I told to myself he did this process again so he gain his powers again I don't know actually what happened ? hope I can understand this and also how in the last scenes in wolverine movie Magneto controlled Logan when he hadn't have any metal in his body also I didn't understand this scenes too so anyone have any recommends for me .

reviews.review_title: The best X-Men movie ever created
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past is the last movie I watched in theater, so I figure I'll start with this one. The first thing I want to say is, I love superhero movies, even though I don't read all the comics, I do love the movies.I've seen all the X-Men movies, and what I don't like about X-Men movies is the lack of consistency. So, to enjoy this movie you just have to take what you think is good and forget about those aren't consistent. Because I think only X-Men: First Class is the only prequel that go along with the storyline, but if you haven't seen the other movies you can't enjoy the full potential of this one.Despite all the controversy about this movie and not so convincing trailer, Days of future past is a great movie to watch, I definitely had a good time. It started strong with future scene of the X-Men universe and it has those saddening tune along the movie. It has action from various character that you always wanted from X-Men universe of course, humor that will make you chuckle here and there, and the plot of the movie, I enjoy the story. It has a nice pace that make you stay focus to the screen. The cast and crew definitely did a good job.For the next movie(s), I hope they hold the consistency and make an even better piece than this one. With a strong story, fun, and doesn't left the audience with unanswered questions. Of course they like to leave them to the audience's imagination but I still think It's better to have the answer even if it's hidden somewhere in the movie, I hate a plot hole.The best X-Men movie ever created, so far...

As I sat down and wait for the movie to show, I recall all the X-Men movie released in the past and put my expectation to be a little more higher. As the movie started, I can't imagine how they show great value to good details and script. The details shows great value of work and definitely a high level of movie expertise. The movie started in the future in which tragedy struck both humans and mutants alike. That tragedy has taught them the value of decisions we're making in the past on how it will affect our future. One small mistake, can lead to a huge amount of downfall of man. As Wolverine (Hugh Jackman) cast aside an effort to reunite two of his future companion, Professor X (James McAvoy) and Magneto (Michael Fassbender), it came across to a section of the movie wherein I was struck the most. It is where Peter/Quicksilver (Evan Peters) hilariously struck the role with good showmanship and of course a good attitude. I can favor more of Marvel Movies released this year but as for the move, X-Men:Days of Future Past, I can say that it was a spectacular released and will grant the viewers the enjoyment and the curiosity on what will happen on the next movie.8/10

reviews.review_title: Bryan Singer once again proves himself to be a good director
reviews.content: Bryan Singer once again proves himself to be a good director, if there is one person who can direct X-Men movies, Bryan Singer can. President Richard Nixon is back as this movie is set in 1973. The cast is loaded with talent. Everyone gives a good performance, Marvel and Stan Lee and the women look great. The Blue woman thinks no one wants to look at her. Costumes are outstanding, the special effects are well done, the script includes time travel. What more can an X-Men Movie need? The action is really great in this film. Also, this is the most emotional out of the X-Men films.Seems like the filmmakers had some fun making this Marvel Comic Flick.Overall, if you're an X-Men fan or a superhero fan, this is a must see.

This movie is by far one of the best X-men movies. The plot twist is very intriguing where it has Wolverine (Huge Jackson) going back into the past in order to alter the future. Also in the movie, the X-men face an enemy like never before which forces Professor X and Magneto to work together. This is the type of movie where you have to watch from start to end because the director, Bryan Singer, is always throwing little hints and flashbacks that connect all of the previous X-men movies with this one. You won't need to watch all the previous movies in order to understand this one; however I would suggest watching the previous movie X-Men:First Class (2011) because that movie is most directly tied to this one.Overall, this is a great movie that is very enjoyable no matter if you read the comic books or not.

This is the biggest X-Men movie,having the old and new cast together in one movie is amazing the scenes cutting from 1973 to 2023 was displayed perfectly,this movie is one of the best Marvel films I have seen.

reviews.review_title: Nothing will prepare you for this movie..
reviews.content: I just saw Xmen days of future past last night ! Prior to watching the film, I reviewed X1, X2, and First Class. The tone of those movies were relatively the same..however Xmen days of future past takes things to a grand scale. The thing I liked about this movie - every character contributed something..every time someone was one screen - they played an integral part of the storyline..I also enjoyed the balance between the future and past pieces. I was however taken back by how dark this movie was - it was extremely dark! You could tell Singer pushed the limits of the PG-13 rating..from language..to nudity...to violence... all in all I give this film a 10/10 (as it so greatly deserves) Only because it's a treat to Xmen fans also a treat to the casual movie goer - it truly is a fantastic cinematic experience!Can't wait for the sequel in 2016!!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: One of the Better X-Men Movies
reviews.content: X-Men: Days of Future Past was an interesting movie. I think that the whole Kitty Pryde being able to send people back in time was stretching her powers a little lot. However, I did enjoy seeing many new characters come to life on the live-action screen. Even though characters like Blink, Warpath, and Sunspot all had minor roles, I enjoyed seeing them in action, and think that they should get more prominent roles if they are integrated into the MCU. I think that Mystique should've been more true to the comics and been a true assassin, but that's not the way Fox took it unfortunately. The only reason I rate this movie higher than most of the other X-Men movies is because of the diversity in characters.

The story line in nice. The timeline may bother some people as it may be difficult to understand how Charles Xaviers was alive after the Xmen: the last stand. But the action and the effects were truly amazing. Wolverine had a major part in this edition of Xmen but I would have enjoyed more if I could see more of his fighting scenes. As a whole the film is interesting through out and will not bore you even for a second. A must watch.

reviews.review_title: Watting To See in this Movie
reviews.content: X man my Favorite Movie... every seen all parts on X man... its really Awesome...Waiting to See This Part.when this movie is reselect... i just waiting to see in this Movie...Hugh Jack man.. are The Favorite Actor.. in X man Movie..For a movie that's crowded with so many characters, it's surprising that all of the characters included feel meaningful and aren't shoehorned in. We have Hugh Jackman returning as Wolverine, and there's not much to say about him that hasn't already been said. He is Wolverine, the role is made for him and he absolutely owns it. James McAvoy and Michael Fassbender are incredible as Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr respectively, their characters have an amazing relationship and the two of them are just phenomenal at pulling it off. We also have the future X-Men cast with the like of Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellan and Ellen Page, and while they have a lot less screen time they're still great. I was surprised at how prominent a role Jennifer Lawrence had as Mystique, over the past few months I've had a growing dislike towards Jennifer Lawrence but I can't deny that she is great in this role. Then we have all of the new characters, like Bolivar Trask (Peter Dinklage), Bishop (Omar Sy) and Blink (Bingbing Fan), all of whom are great. But there is one new character who is greater than all, and that character is Quicksilver.

As a big fan of X-Men for more than 25 years, i say that this movie really made my day!!! I was counting the days for it to come to the theater and i wasn't disappointed, on the contrary! It is absolutely breathtaking! Great actors such as Michael Fassbender, James Macvoy, Evan Peters, were extraordinary on this movie! It's about time that Evan Peters gets more attention from the big picture scene! Evan as Quicksilver was fantastic! In fact, i think my favorite scene was with him! Could see this movie over and over! In fact, i really will see it again! Eaven if you're not an X-Men fan, you will enjoy this one. Michael Fassbender and James Macvoy are also fantastic in the movie! Hands down for Michael Fassbender, one of my favorite actors!! If you're an action special effects fan, you must see this movie!

Really One of the Best Movies I've ever seen Awesome script & best Director to have this Script to made this movie an Epic & Cgi team just made everything that we Comic fans can Read & Imagine made came true... I think its really hard to get everything-everyone have same equal lining & play the script it's really that much hard to find those sequence & edit to make it 1 hour 30 minutes & give everything to make believe what really happening in Days of Future past & Bryan Singer just made it Awesome. Nothing to say 'bout Hugh Jackman or Ian Mckellen both were outstanding. I really love the Young Professor X: Jamess McAvoy, so Intense. The best part of the movie i think when Quick Silver(Evan Peters) was saving Magneto(Michael fassbender) & Professor X(James Mcavoy) from getting shot everything slows down through his Super speed, must say Cgi of this Bullet Time Sequence is too cool & drastically funny to watch..... Script, Direction, character Play & Animation Everything is so Perfect... As Marvel

A screen extravaganza that we long waited for.X-Men: Days of Future Past, adapted from the Uncanny X-Men storyline of the same name, is about the mutants being in a dystopian future where they are wiped out by the Sentinels which are huge robots that are superior to them and have the ability to replicate their powers.They have to send Wolverine back in time (a la Terminator) to prevent Mystique from an act that caused the creation of the Sentinels and thus creating an alternate universe in which the last 50 years in their lives are altered (a la Star Trek). The film is superior to every other feature in the franchise on every aspect.Bryan Singer is back with a style of originality and creativity.The script by Simon Kinberg is very well paced and structured.The production design by John Myhre and set decoration by Louise Mingenbach are great.And John Ottman's score refreshes our memory with the old themes of the original trilogy and providing new terrific ones such as Hope (Xavier's theme). The ensemble cast of the film was a great eye candy especially for the devoted fans,and easter eggs were thrown by the characters at every chance possible (Quicksilver remarking that his mother knew someone who could do stuff like Erik).Hugh Jackman as Logan, arguably the main protagonist of the franchise, gave yet another down-to-the-bone characterization of the Wolverine.It was exciting to see him carrying such a life-threatening responsibility on his own. James McAvoys made a brilliant work as young Xavier with a performance drastically different from First Class, this alcoholic hairy desperate Professor X is unquestionably a new treat to the viewers.Fassbender is the same old Fassbender as Erik but I really believe that his role was a little bit overshadowed in this one, but he did an excellent job overall.Jennifer Lawrence excelled as Raven in the evolution of her character to emerge as Mystique , but the heavily CGI-based make-up didn't quite feel convincing as Rebecca Romijn's authentic one in the original trilogy.Nicholas Hoult was the perfect sidekick as Hank McCoy but didn't do much as Beast. But it was Peter Dinklage as Trask and Evan Peters as Quicksilver who stole the show.Dinklage, though an inferior villain to the mutants, was a very great threat as the cunning arrogant inventor, and Quicksilver's slowmo sequence accompanied by Jim Croce's Time in a Bottle is the most memorable part of the film.Josh Helman was amazing as young Stryker and though his role was comparably small, he did it with grace.It was great to see back Ian Mckellen and Patrick Stewart (who gave his best Professor X performance) and you'd wish to see more of them.Also in addition to bringing back Shawn Ashmore as the now mature mutant leader Iceman, Ellen Page as Kitty Pryde who is the connecting gear of the plot and Daniel Cudmore as Colossus.And also introducing interesting new characters such as Blink portrayed by Bingbing Fan and Omar Sy as Bishop.But there were a few letdowns: Cutting down most of Storm's role due to Halle Berry's pregnancy (she has only one line of dialog and 30 seconds of action), cutting Anna Paquin's role down to a mere cameo of Rogue with Bobby in the very end, and I was personally disappointed that Lucas Till had only a small cameo as Havok, I wished he could have a more significant role.We were compensated with surprising awesome cameos of Famke Janssen as Jean and James Marsden as Scott that even topped Jackman's cameo in First Class, and also a blink-and-you-miss-it moment of Kelsey Grammar as Beast. The action sequences were well choreographed, and edited perfectly to seamlessly flow with each other.You can hardly feel distracted when jumping from the future to the past, and it's a huge suspense when you could see how an action in the 70s could affect directly the protagonists in 2024. Overall, the film is nearly flawless and hits all the right points.Hold on till after the credits for a pacing scene to the next installment.By far the best X-Men film, rating 9/10

This was literally the best X-Men movie yet! I think everyone should go see it! It is worth your time and money. Even if you have never seen any of the other movies, it is still a movie that is easy to understand what is going on! Also, if you have friends that have seen the others then I'm sure they would give you a background story of what's going on. Even if they don't, I don't think you will be lost when you watch this movie! This was directed really good and I loved the cast! I can't wait to see the next X-Men movie! They have an awesome film to outdo! I can't wait to buy this movie on DVD, so I can show my family what they missed at the theater. Also, so I can watch it again and again! I hope you get the chance to see this movie because I do believe you will like it!

When I went to see X-men: Days of Future Past I had significantly high standards, yet it still blew my mind. This movie was Awesome. The story's mind-blowing premise is intrinsically detailed, and fits perfectly into the previous movie X-Men: First Class. The storyline is a fast paced thriller that will have you constantly wondering what will happen next. This new installment to the X- men series connects perfectly to the previous X-men: First Class. The storyline takes us through multiple time dimensions when Wolverine is sent back in time to reconnect Professor Xavier and Magneto to save the lives and alter the history of Mutants in society. The dual acting of Professor Xavier by James McAvoy and Patrick Stewart is amazing. Seeing these two actors portray the same character is a delight; the two have a connection that brings both the past and present day Professor Xavier into a seemingly uniform character. The same goes for Michael Fassbender and Ian McKellan portraying Magneto. The addition of new X-men character is also a great addition to the movie. The cast truly made this movie as great as it is. Seeing the struggles, progressions, and similarities of the characters in different time dimensions played a huge role in tying the whole movie together.

It was a great movie since all the characters are born to play the part. The story was based on the comic book series, and I appreciate how they try to be as accurate as possible about the plot. - One thing that really bothered me was that "Jennifer Lawrence" as Mystique is not really working. I don't see her as this actress that can play an evil and serious character, and they really should do something about that. There are some scenes where she couldn't play properly or maybe it is just the way I see her. She seems more like an actress that can play a much nicer role. - All in all, I loved the movie and I will recommend this for a friend!

reviews.review_title: Singer's Vision Is A Cut Above The Rest
reviews.content: Make no mistake...THIS is a Bryan Singer X-Men movie. It has heart, suspense, and a further reaching purpose which sets it apart from much of Marvel's arsenal of films. The cast is truly electrifying and they fill their characters to the brim without overflowing. It was amazing to see Lawrence as Mystique who is much more developed in this than in any other X-Men movie. Aside Mystique are the groundbreaking performances of McAvoy and Fassbender who once again continue their charming yin and yang roles as Xavier and Magneto. And let us not forget Jackman as Wolverine. He arguably slipped up with The Wolverine but make no mistake: he is back to his cigar puffing self!As a fan of the franchise it is nice to most of the original cast, even if they do only slip onto the screen for a minute or two.
